description: The Business Confidence survey published by Statistics Portugal provides an assessment of the present state of businesses in Portugal. It offers insights into the overall economic performance in the near future. If there is a positive economic growth, it suggests that there will be optimistic movements for the EUR. Conversely, a negative growth is viewed as pessimistic or bearish.

title: Consumer Confidence
description: The Consumer Confidence index published by Statistics Portugal is a key indicator used to assess the level of confidence consumers have in the state of the economy. When consumer confidence is high, it tends to lead to economic growth, whereas low confidence often leads to economic decline. A high reading of this index is considered positive for the EUR (Euro currency) and is seen as a signal for potential market strength, while a low reading is considered negative for the EUR and is seen as a warning sign for potential market weakness.

title: Services Sentiment
description: The European Commission releases a Services Sentiment Indicator to measure how businesses in the services sector feel. This indicator is based on a survey that asks firms about their current and future demand. Since the services sector makes up about two thirds of the Euro-zone's total GDP, the Services Confidence indicator is important for gauging the overall health of the economy. When Services Confidence is high, it indicates that production and employment are likely to increase in the future. The indicator is calculated by comparing the number of positive answers to negative answers. A positive number suggests that there is confidence in the service sector, while a negative number indicates a lack of confidence.

title: Industrial Confidence
description: The European Commission's Industrial Confidence index assesses the level of optimism among industrial executives regarding economic activity. The survey includes questions about orders and inventory accumulation. A strong industrial confidence level encourages economic growth, while a low level indicates a potential downturn. A high reading is considered favorable for the EUR currency, while a low reading is viewed as unfavorable.

news.body: Toxic gas leaked from part of BASF's petrochemical complex in Ludwigshafen, Germany on Thursday, following what the company has called an operational disruption in a post to social media.

news.headline: Sweden Expects Budget Deficits in 2024-25; Maintains Previously Raised Bond-Issuance Targets
news.body:

title: Consumer Price Index (MoM)
description: The National Bank of Belgium calculates and publishes the Consumer Price Index (CPI), which tracks changes in the prices of a typical selection of goods and services sold to consumers. Inflation causes the purchasing power of the Euro to decrease. The CPI is an important tool for measuring inflation and shifts in consumer spending patterns. In general, a higher CPI reading is viewed as beneficial for the Euro, while a lower reading is seen as unfavorable.

title: Dallas Fed Manufacturing Business Index
description: Every month, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas conducts the Texas Manufacturing Outlook Survey to gather information about the current state of factory activity in Texas. Companies are surveyed about changes in output, employment, orders, prices, and other factors compared to the previous month. The survey responses are used to calculate an index for each indicator, which is determined by subtracting the percentage of respondents reporting a decrease from the percentage reporting an increase.

title: 3-Month Bill Auction
description: The calendar shows the average rate of return on the Treasury bills sold by the US Department of Treasury. These bills are short-term investments that mature in one year or less. The yield on these bills indicates the profit that an investor will earn by holding the bond until it reaches maturity. Investors keep track of the changes in yield and compare the average rate at each auction to previous auctions of the same type of security. This helps them gauge the overall state of government debt.

title: 6-Month Bill Auction
description: The calendar shows the average return on the Treasury bills sold by the US Department of Treasury. These bills are short-term securities that mature in one year or less. The return on the bills signifies the amount of money an investor will earn by holding the bond until it reaches maturity. Investors track the volatility of the return and compare the average rate at each auction to previous rates for the same security. This helps them gauge the overall state of government debt.

title: Unemployment Rate
description: The Unemployment Rate, published by the Central Bank of the Russian Federation, is calculated by dividing the number of people without work by the total number of people in the workforce who are not in the military. It is an important indicator for the Russian economy, as it represents the level of joblessness. A higher rate indicates limited growth within the job market, which can result in a weaker economy overall. Conversely, a lower rate is generally viewed as a positive sign for the Russian Ruble currency, while an increase in the rate is seen as negative.

news.headline: Nordic Stocks Dropped Friday; Truecaller Series B Took Biggest Hit
news.body:
Nordic stocks declined Friday, with the OMX Nordic 40 Index declining 0.9%.
Truecaller AB Series B posted the largest decline during the session, cratering 31.9%, followed by Electrolux Professional AB Series B shares, which plunged 17.8%. Shares of Electrolux AB Series B tumbled 13.6%.

news.headline: Agnico Eagle Expects 2023 Production at High End of Guidance After Finland Mine's Permit Restored
news.body:
By Robb M. Stewart
Agnico Eagle Mines expects production for the year to come in toward the upper end of its target after a court in Finland restored the gold producer's operating permit for its Kittila mine in the country's north, allowing it to operate at a higher capacity.

news.headline: Russia's Central Bank Raises Key Rate More Than Expected
news.body:
By Paul Hannon
Russia's central bank raised its key interest rate for the fourth time in an effort to contain a surge in inflation as manpower and other resources are diverted to sustain the invasion of Ukraine.

news.headline: UniCredit Shareholders Approve EUR2.5 Billion Buyback Plan
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
UniCredit shareholders have given their approval for the Italian bank to buyback up to 2.5 billion euros worth ($2.64 billion) of shares.

Airbus said it was awarded a U.K. Ministry of Defence contract to provide support for a military satellite communications system.

news.body: Shares of Universal Music Group slumped in Friday morning trading after revenue growth from streaming came below analysts' expectations for the third quarter.

news.headline: Sanofi Shares Tumble After Warning of Profit Hit From Investment, Taxes
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of Sanofi fell sharply after the company warned it expects business earnings for next year to be hit by its plans to boost investment in research and development and changes in global tax regulations.

news.headline: Sanofi Backs Guidance After Earnings, Sales Miss Views
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi confirmed its 2023 guidance after it reported business earnings and sales that came in slightly below consensus forecasts, with currency headwinds offsetting a strong launch of its Beyfortus vaccine.

news.headline: Eni Raises Guidance After 3Q Beat Expectations Despite Weaker Prices
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Eni raised its full-year operating profit guidance after third-quarter results beat analysts' expectations, boosted by the exploration and production division.

news.headline: Siemens Acquisition of Heliox Faces UK Competition Probe
news.body:
By Michael Susin
The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority said it has launched an investigation regarding the acquisition of Heliox by a Siemens subsidiary.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Split Consumer-Healthcare, Pharma Businesses -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi plans to split its consumer-healtchare and pharmaceutical operations, making it the latest big drugmaker to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.headline: CaixaBank's 3Q Profit Boosted by Higher Lending Income
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
CaixaBank reported a rise in third-quarter profit on higher lending income despite a decline in its loans portfolio.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Spin Off Consumer-Healthcare Business
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi said it plans to spin off its consumer-healthcare unit into a publicly listed entity, making it the latest pharmaceutical giant to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.headline: Safran Backs Guidance After Revenue Boost
news.body: Safran confirmed its forecasts for the year after revenue jumped in the third quarter as air traffic for narrowbody jets translated into strong demand for spare parts.

title: Gross Domestic Product w.d.a (YoY)
description: The Statistisches Bundesamt Deutschland releases the Gross Domestic Product, which is a measurement of the total value of goods and services produced in Germany. This serves as a significant indicator of the country's economic activity and overall well-being. If the GDP reading is high or exceeds expectations, it has a positive impact on the EUR currency. Conversely, a declining trend is viewed as negative or bearish.

news.body: Toxic gas leaked from part of BASF's petrochemical complex in Ludwigshafen, Germany on Thursday, following what the company has called an operational disruption in a post to social media.

news.headline: Sweden Expects Budget Deficits in 2024-25; Maintains Previously Raised Bond-Issuance Targets
news.body:
By Emese Bartha
Sweden's central government budget balance has continued to develop more strongly than previously expected, with a surplus this year, but two years of deficits will follow, the National Debt Office said in its borrowing review on Thursday.

news.headline: Mercedes-Benz Shares Fall As Profit Drops, Headwinds Continue
news.body:
By David Sachs
Mercedes-Benz Group shares fell Thursday after the car maker reported a drop in third-quarter profit due to lower demand and currency effects, and warned that headwinds would continue for the rest of the year.

news.headline: German Business Sentiment Ticked Up in October on Renewed Optimism -- Update
news.body:

Business sentiment in Germany improved in October, snapping five consecutive months of declines, as firms in the manufacturing, services and construction sectors became more optimistic on future expectations.

news.headline: German Business Sentiment Ticked Up in October
news.body:

news.body:
By Adam L. Cataldo
New York plans to invest $300 million in 25 renewable energy projects in what it said is the largest investment of its kind by any state in the U.S.

title: Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (YoY)
description: The National Institute of Statistics releases the Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (HICP), which is a measure of inflation that is consistent across EU Member States. It is similar to national Consumer Price Indices (CPI) but includes items such as personal computers, new cars, and airfares, while excluding owner/occupier housing and council tax. A high HICP reading is considered positive for the Euro, while a low reading is considered negative.

news.headline: CaixaBank's 3Q Profit Boosted by Higher Lending Income
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
CaixaBank reported a rise in third-quarter profit on higher lending income despite a decline in its loans portfolio.

news.headline: Spain Keeps Adding Jobs as Tourists Visit En Masse -- Update
news.body:
By Joshua Kirby
Spain employed more people than ever before between July and September, thanks in large part to a resurgent tourism sector that has boosted the country's jobs market.

news.headline: Spanish Jobless Rate Remained Largely Stable Over the Summer
news.body:
By Joshua Kirby
Spain's unemployment rate stabilized in the third quarter, boosted by a resurgent tourism sector.

news.headline: Iberdrola Raises Guidance After Earnings Jump
news.body:
Iberdrola lifted its profit guidance for the year after posting higher earnings for the first nine months.
The Spanish energy company on Thursday reported net profit of 3.64 billion euros ($3.85 billion), up from EUR3.10 billion in the first nine months of last year.

news.headline: Orange, MasMovil Plan to Sell Spain Assets to Digi Over EU Concerns, Reuters Reports
news.body: --Orange and MasMovil plan to sell assets to address European Union authorities' competition concerns over their proposed combination in Spain and picked Romania's Digi Communications as the buyer, Reuters reports, citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: Santander Sees 2023 Targets on Track After Interest Income Boosts Profit
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Banco Santander said it remains on track to meet its 2023 targets after it reported a forecast-beating rise in net profit for the third quarter, with income from higher interest rates boosting its top line.

news.headline: Correction to Naturgy Article
news.body: Naturgy approved a second interim dividend for the year of 50 European cents a share. "Naturgy Raises 2023 Core Earnings Guidance on Higher Nine-Month Results," at 0727 GMT, incorrectly said the interim dividend was 5 European cents.

news.headline: Masdar to Buy Stake in Iberdrola's East Anglia 3 Wind Farm, Cinco Dias Reports
news.body: --Abu Dhabi's Masdar is set to buy a 49% stake in Spanish utility Iberdrola's wind project, known as East Anglia 3, off the Suffolk coast in the Southern North Sea, Cinco Dias reports, citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: Cellnex Names Raimon Trias Fita as CFO
news.body:
Cellnex Telecom appointed Raimon Trias Fita to succeed Jose Manuel Aisa Mancho as chief financial officer.
The Spanish wireless-telecommunications company said Monday that Trias Fita's appointment would be effective as of Dec. 1.

news.headline: Grenergy Sells Spain Solar Projects to Allianz for EUR270.6 Million
news.body:
By Helena Smolak
Grenergy Renovables said it agreed to sell two solar-energy projects in Spain to Allianz Capital Partners for 270.6 million euros ($286.2 million), and that proceeds will be used to fund future growth.

news.headline: Spain Sells EUR3 Billion in New November 2039 Inflation-Linked Bond -- Update
news.body:
By Emese Bartha
Spain issued 3 billion euros ($3.17 billion) in the syndicated launch of a new inflation-linked bond with maturity in 2039, lengthening its real-yield curve on Tuesday, one of the lead manager banks said.

news.body:

Spain issued 3 billion euros ($3.17 billion) in the syndicated launch of a new inflation-linked bond with maturity in 2039, lengthening its real-yield curve on Tuesday, one of the lead manager banks said.

news.headline: Coca-Cola, Pernod Ricard to Launch Ready-To-Drink Cocktail
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Coca-Cola and Pernod Ricard are set to launch a ready-to-drink cocktail made with vodka brand Absolut and sparkling soft drink Sprite starting early next year.

news.headline: Spain Plans to Launch New November 2039-Dated Inflation-Linked Bond
news.body:
By Emese Bartha
Spain hired banks for the syndicated launch of a new bond linked to eurozone HICP-ex tobacco, with maturity in November 2039, one of the lead manager banks said Monday.

news.headline: FTSE 100 Holds Steady on Energy Companies Though Israeli Stocks, Airlines Slump -- Market Talk
news.body: Energean shares fall after Hamas's attack on Israel as the company, which is developing a substantial gas field offshore Israel, faces uncertainty, AJ Bell writes. While the FTSE 100 was steady on Monday--supported by oil heavyweights BP and Shell--, Energean shares are down 19%, languishing among London's worst performers, alongside fellow Israeli-based companies BATM Advanced Communications and MTI Wireless Edge, both down 8.5% and 11%, respectively. Airlines also fell as the market priced in higher fuel costs and, potentially, less willingness to travel to certain locations, AJ Bell's investment director Russ Mould says, with International Consolidated Airlines Group, Ryanair, Wizz Air and easyJet all falling 5.3%, 3.0%, 5.1% and 5.5%, respectively. (joseph.hoppe@wsj.com)

news.headline: European Defense, Energy Stocks Rise, Airlines Slide After Attack on Israel
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
European defense and energy stocks rose Monday, while airline stocks fell after the surprise attack by Hamas on southern Israel over the weekend.

news.headline: Sanofi, Janssen Team Up to Develop, Commercialize Vaccine for E. Coli
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi and Johnson & Johnson's Janssen Pharmaceuticals have entered into an agreement to jointly develop and commercialize a vaccine candidate against extraintestinal pathogenic Escherichia coli, a cause of bacterial infections.

news.headline: European Telecom CEOs Call on EU to Make Tech Companies Pay for Networks
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
European telecommunications companies urged the European Union to overhaul the industry's regulatory framework and make big technology companies contribute to fund the costs of network infrastructure.

news.headline: Trending: BBVA Launches Second Extraordinary Share Buyback in Two Years
news.body: 1127 GMT - Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria is among the most mentioned companies across news items over the past 12 hours, according to Factiva data, after the Spanish bank said it will begin buying back shares as of Monday. The bank said that it received authorization to launch a 1 billion euro ($1.06 billion) share buyback program. The bank intends to acquire 564.6 million shares during the buyback which is scheduled to end no later than Sept. 21 of next year, the bank said. The European Central Bank green-lit the buyback plan which was disclosed back in July. This is the bank's second extraordinary buyback over the last two years. In April BBVA finished a EUR422 million buyback and in August 2022 it completed a EUR3.16 billion buyback. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (pierre.bertrand@wsj.com)

news.headline: BBVA to Launch $1.1 Billion Buyback After ECB Approval
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria is launching a share buyback program of up to 1 billion euros ($1.06 billion) after it received authorization from the European Central Bank.

title: Business Climate
description: The Business climate indicator, which is released by the European Commission, uses monthly surveys to provide a timely and accurate evaluation of the current economic situation in the Eurozone. It can be seen as a representation of survey results, with a high level indicating a positive economic situation, while a low level indicates a challenging business climate. An increase or decrease in the indicator suggests an improvement or decline in economic activity and business conditions. The movement of the indicator is closely connected to the industrial production in the Eurozone.

title: Economic Sentiment Indicator
description: The European Commission's Euro Zone Economic Confidence survey measures how consumers feel about the state of the economy. title: Consumer Confidence
description: The European Commission releases a measure known as the Consumer Confidence, which is a key indicator of how confident consumers are in the economy. When consumer confidence is high, it encourages economic growth, while low confidence often leads to a decline in the economy. A high reading of this indicator is viewed as positive for the EUR currency, while a low reading is seen as negative.

title: Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (MoM)
description: The HICP, or Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices, is a measurement of consumer prices that is calculated and released by Destatis. It is based on a standardized statistical methodology that is used by all European Union member countries. The HICP is utilized by the Governing Council of the EU to determine and evaluate price stability in the entire euro area in a measurable way.

title: BoC's Rogers speech
description: In December 2021, Carolyn Rogers was named Senior Deputy Governor of the Bank of Canada (BOC) for a period of seven years. Her statements regarding the future direction of policies, the state of the economy, and the level of inflation could potentially influence the performance of the Canadian dollar relative to other major currencies.

title: Retail Sales s.a. (MoM)
description: The Australian Bureau of Statistics conducts a Retail Sales survey to gather data on goods sold by retailers. This survey includes a sample of various types and sizes of retail stores and is used as an indicator of the Australian economy's pace. It provides insights into the performance of the retail sector in the short and medium term. A high reading suggests positive economic growth, which is favorable for the Australian Dollar (AUD), while a low reading is viewed as negative or unfavorable.

news.headline: Preview -- Barron's
news.body:
Wednesday 11/1
The Bureau of Labor Statistics releases the Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey for September. There were 9.61 million job openings on the last business day of August, down from a peak of just over 12 million in March of 2022, but still well above historical averages.

news.headline: Coherus BioSciences Shares Climb 12% on FDA Approval for Cancer Treatment Loqtorzi
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Shares of Coherus BioSciences climbed 12% to $2.96 in after-hours trading after the company said the Food and Drug Administration approved Loqtorzi to treat nasopharyngeal cancer when used with chemotherapy.

news.headline: Wells Fargo Vice Chairman Thomas Nides to Leave Co., Turn Attention to Middle East
news.body:
By Stephen Nakrosis
Wells Fargo said Vice Chairman Thomas Nides, the former U.S. Ambassador to Israel, will leave the company, effective immediately, to return his attention to events unfolding in the Middle East.

news.headline: Intuitive Machines Sets January Date for NASA Lunar Mission
news.body:
By Stephen Nakrosis
Intuitive Machines said its IM-1 lunar mission, an attempted lunar landing as part of a National Aeronautics and Space Administration initiative, will take place in January of next year.

news.headline: Morgan Stanley Awards Next CEO, Other Candidates Awards Valued at $20 Million
news.body:
By Denny Jacob
Morgan Stanley issued stock-based awards to its next chief executive officer and other leaders who were in the running for the top job.

news.headline: Tupperware Brands Loses PcW as Auditor
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Tupperware Brands said PricewaterhouseCoopers isn't willing to stand for reappointment as its accounting firm, according to a Securities and Exchange Commission filing.

news.headline: Marsh & McLennan to Delist From London Stock Exchange
news.body:
By Ben Glickman
Marsh & McLennan will delist its shares from the London Stock Exchange, the company said.

news.headline: Coherus BioSciences Gets FDA Approval for Loqtorzi, Chemotherapy Combination
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Coherus BioSciences and Shanghai Junshi Biosciences said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved its Loqtorzi antibody to treat nasopharyngeal cancer when used with chemotherapy.

news.headline: Trending: Some Analysts Raise Intel Price Target
news.body: 14:37 -- Intel is one of the most mentioned companies in the U.S. across all news items in the last 12 hours, according to Factiva data. Some analysts, including HSBC and Morgan Stanley, raised their price targets on Intel stock Friday, after the company reported third-quarter financial results that came in better than estimates. The stock is enjoying one of its best days in a year on Friday. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (stephen.nakrosis@wsj.com)

news.headline: Charter Shares Fall 9% After Soft 3Q Broadband Gains, Higher CapEx
news.body:
By Will Feuer
Shares of Charter Communications fell after the cable giant reported a deceleration in new broadband subscribers and said it will spend more on upgrading its network this year than planned.

news.headline: Verano Shares Down After Suing DOJ Over Marijuana Prohibition
news.body:
By Dean Seal
Shares of Verano Holdings declined after the company and others sued Attorney General Merrick Garland to strike down federal marijuana restrictions.

news.headline: Toronto Stocks Slide; Corus Entertainment Plummets on Dividend Suspension
news.body:

Stocks in Toronto were firmly in red territory midday Friday. Statistics Canada reported that advance results of wholesale sales for the month of September in Canada point to flat.

news.headline: Duke Energy to Help Build Clean Energy System to Produce Green Hydrogen
news.body:
By Chris Wack
Duke Energy will break ground in the near future in DeBary, Fla., on a demonstration project to successfully create clean energy using an end-to-end system to produce, store and combust 100% green hydrogen.

title: Gross Domestic Product (YoY)
description: The Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is a metric published by the German Federal Statistical Office, which calculates the overall worth of all products and services generated within the country. The GDP is an important gauge of Germany's economic well-being and activity. When the GDP shows a strong performance or exceeds expectations, it has a positive impact on the euro currency. Conversely, a declining trend is seen as unfavorable or pessimistic.

title: Gross Domestic Product (QoQ)
description: The Statistisches Bundesamt Deutschland releases the Gross Domestic Product, which calculates the overall value of Germany's goods and services produced. A strong or higher than anticipated GDP has a positive impact on the EUR, while a decrease in GDP is viewed as negative or bearish.

title: Consumer Price Index (MoM)
description: The Germany consumer price index, which is published by the Statistisches Bundesamt Deutschland, tracks the average price fluctuation of items and services that households buy for consumption. It is a crucial indicator for assessing both inflation and shifts in purchasing habits. A higher value is favorable (or bullish) for the EUR, whereas a lower value is unfavorable (or bearish).

title: Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (YoY)
description: HICP, or the Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices, is an index that calculates and shares data on consumer prices. It is created by Destatis, the Statistical Office of the European Union, using a standardized approach that is consistent across all EU member countries. The HICP is an important tool for the Governing Council of the EU, as it helps to define and evaluate price stability in the euro area by providing quantitative information on prices.

title: BoC's Governor Macklem speech
description: Tiff Macklem took on the role of Governor of the Bank of Canada on June 3, 2020, making him both the Governor and Chairman of the Bank's Board of Directors. Before his appointment, Macklem served as the Dean of the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto for six years. He also held the position of Senior Deputy Governor at the Bank of Canada from July 2010 to May 2014. In addition, Macklem was the first Chair of the Financial Stability Board's Standing Committee for Standards Implementation from 2009 to 2013, and represented the Bank of Canada at the FSB.

title: Fiscal Balance, pesos
description: The Fiscal Balance, provided by SCHP, is the contrast between the revenue collected by the government and the amount it spends. In simple terms, if the result is negative, it indicates that Mexico's financial situation is positive, which is beneficial for the Peso. Conversely, an increase in the federal deficit is seen as unfavorable.

news.headline: Preview -- Barron's

title: ANZ Business Confidence
description: The ANZ releases a report called Business Confidence which provides insight into the business outlook in New Zealand. This report is useful for analyzing the current economic situation in the short term. When the numbers in the report increase, it indicates that there is an increase in business investment, which in turn leads to higher levels of output. As a result, a high reading in the report is viewed as positive or optimistic for the New Zealand Dollar (NZD), while a low reading is seen as negative or pessimistic.

news.headline: The FTSE 100 Closed Down 0.9% on Earnings Disappointment, Geopolitical Tensions
news.body: The FTSE 100 closed down 0.9% Friday as mainly disappointing earnings and heightened tensions in the Middle East led to another weekly loss for global stock indices, IG analyst Axel Rudolph says in a note. "Heightened tensions in the Middle East and a plethora of central bank decisions by the likes of the BoJ, Fed and BoE will dominate the calendar next week ahead of Friday's all-important U.S. Non-Farm Payrolls," Rudolph says. NatWest--down 12%--was the session's biggest faller after reporting that 3Q pretax profit and net income missed consensus, followed by Lloyds Banking, down 3.4%, and Weir Group, down 3.1%. Rentokil Initial was the day's biggest riser, up 3.6%.

news.headline: Trending: Unilever Sets Out Action Plan to Address Underperformance
news.body: 1011 GMT - Unilever is the second-most mentioned company across news items over the past two hours, according to Factiva data. The Anglo-Dutch retailer--which owns consumer brands such as Ben & Jerry's ice cream and Dove soap--set out on Thursday an action plan to address underperformance by focusing on its most profitable brands, simplified productivity and performance-oriented leadership. The new plan was announced after the group reported a mainly price-driven 3Q sales growth--while volumes fell--and backed its 2023 guidance. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (michael.susin@wsj.com)

title: Private Sector Credit (YoY)
description: The Private Sector Credit report, issued by the Reserve Bank of Australia, represents the borrowed money by the Australian private sector. It indicates the ability of the private sector to handle significant expenditures, which can contribute to economic growth. This report is widely regarded as an important indicator of business conditions and the overall state of the Australian economy. In general, a higher reading is viewed as favorable or optimistic for the Australian dollar (AUD), while a lower reading is seen as unfavorable.

title: Private Sector Credit (MoM)
description: The Private Sector Credit is a value reported by the Reserve Bank of Australia, indicating the amount of money borrowed by the private sector in the country. It serves as a measure of the private sector's ability to handle major expenses, which in turn can contribute to economic growth. This data is often considered as an indicator of business conditions and the overall state of the Australian economy. Typically, a high reading is viewed favorably and can have a positive impact on the value of the Australian dollar (AUD), while a low reading is seen as unfavorable.

news.headline: Preview -- Barron's
news.body:
Wednesday 11/1
The Bureau of Labor Statistics releases the Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey for September. There were 9.61 million job openings on the last business day of August, down from a peak of just over 12 million in March of 2022, but still well above historical averages.

news.headline: Coherus BioSciences Shares Climb 12% on FDA Approval for Cancer Treatment Loqtorzi
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Shares of Coherus BioSciences climbed 12% to $2.96 in after-hours trading after the company said the Food and Drug Administration approved Loqtorzi to treat nasopharyngeal cancer when used with chemotherapy.

news.headline: Wells Fargo Vice Chairman Thomas Nides to Leave Co., Turn Attention to Middle East
news.body:
By Stephen Nakrosis
Wells Fargo said Vice Chairman Thomas Nides, the former U.S. Ambassador to Israel, will leave the company, effective immediately, to return his attention to events unfolding in the Middle East.

news.headline: Intuitive Machines Sets January Date for NASA Lunar Mission
news.body:
By Stephen Nakrosis
Intuitive Machines said its IM-1 lunar mission, an attempted lunar landing as part of a National Aeronautics and Space Administration initiative, will take place in January of next year.

news.headline: Morgan Stanley Awards Next CEO, Other Candidates Awards Valued at $20 Million
news.body:
By Denny Jacob
Morgan Stanley issued stock-based awards to its next chief executive officer and other leaders who were in the running for the top job.

news.headline: Tupperware Brands Loses PcW as Auditor
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Tupperware Brands said PricewaterhouseCoopers isn't willing to stand for reappointment as its accounting firm, according to a Securities and Exchange Commission filing.

news.headline: Marsh & McLennan to Delist From London Stock Exchange
news.body:
By Ben Glickman
Marsh & McLennan will delist its shares from the London Stock Exchange, the company said.

news.headline: Coherus BioSciences Gets FDA Approval for Loqtorzi, Chemotherapy Combination
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Coherus BioSciences and Shanghai Junshi Biosciences said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved its Loqtorzi antibody to treat nasopharyngeal cancer when used with chemotherapy.

news.headline: Trending: Some Analysts Raise Intel Price Target
news.body: 14:37 -- Intel is one of the most mentioned companies in the U.S. across all news items in the last 12 hours, according to Factiva data. Some analysts, including HSBC and Morgan Stanley, raised their price targets on Intel stock Friday, after the company reported third-quarter financial results that came in better than estimates. The stock is enjoying one of its best days in a year on Friday. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (stephen.nakrosis@wsj.com)

news.headline: Charter Shares Fall 9% After Soft 3Q Broadband Gains, Higher CapEx
news.body:
By Will Feuer
Shares of Charter Communications fell after the cable giant reported a deceleration in new broadband subscribers and said it will spend more on upgrading its network this year than planned.

news.headline: Verano Shares Down After Suing DOJ Over Marijuana Prohibition
news.body:
By Dean Seal
Shares of Verano Holdings declined after the company and others sued Attorney General Merrick Garland to strike down federal marijuana restrictions.

news.headline: Toronto Stocks Slide; Corus Entertainment Plummets on Dividend Suspension
news.body:
By Adriano Marchese
Stocks in Toronto were firmly in red territory midday Friday. Statistics Canada reported that advance results of wholesale sales for the month of September in Canada point to flat.

news.headline: Duke Energy to Help Build Clean Energy System to Produce Green Hydrogen
news.body:
By Chris Wack
Duke Energy will break ground in the near future in DeBary, Fla., on a demonstration project to successfully create clean energy using an end-to-end system to produce, store and combust 100% green hydrogen.

title: Annualized Housing Starts
description: The Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport releases the Annualized Housing Starts data, which measures the number of new single-family homes or buildings that have been built. This data is an indicator of the strength of the Japanese housing market, which is closely linked to the overall economy. When the Housing Starts data is high, it is viewed as positive and indicates a strong market for the Japanese yen (JPY). On the other hand, a low reading is seen as negative or bearish for the JPY.

news.body: Japanese industrial giant Itochu has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with engineering firm Orascom Construction for the joint development of ammonia bunkering at the Suez Canal, Itochu said in a news release on Wednesday.

news.headline: Fuel Price Lock Program Boosts Sales for North American 7-Eleven Stores -- OPIS
news.body: A 7-Eleven Inc. program that allows members of the company's fuel rewards program to lock in a lower price for their next fuel purchase has almost doubled store visits by participating customers, according to parent Seven & I Holdings Co.

news.headline: Honda, GM Scrap Plan for Jointly Developed Line of Lower-Priced Electric Vehicles, Says Honda Spokesman
news.body:
By River Davis
TOKYO-General Motors and Honda Motor have decided that their plan to develop a line of lower-priced electric vehicles is not viable, a year and a half after the companies announced the joint effort, a Honda spokesman said Wednesday.

news.headline: Mitsubishi Motors to End Car Production in China
news.body:
By Kosaku Narioka
Mitsubishi Motors plans to end production of cars in China in response to sluggish sales amid stiff competition.

news.headline: Nidec Shares Slump After Drop in Quarterly Profit, Cut in EV Motor Sales Forecast
news.body:
By Kosaku Narioka
Nidec Corp. shares fell sharply after the Japanese electric-motor maker posted a drop in second-quarter net profit and lowered the annual sales forecast for electric-vehicle traction motors.

news.headline: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant, Pfizer in Deal Worth Up to $7.25 Billion -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding has agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in a deal worth up to $7.25 billion as the Swiss pharmaceutical giant seeks to bolster its immunology pipeline.

news.headline: AstraZeneca, Daiichi Sankyo's Enhertu Gets Approval in EU For Lung Cancer Treatment
news.body:
By Michael Susin
AstraZeneca said that its drug Enhertu, which it developed in partnership with Daiichi Sankyo, has been approved in the European Union for the treatment of advanced non-small cell lung cancer.

news.headline: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in $7.25 Billion Deal
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding has agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in a deal worth up to $7.25 billion that will give it rights to a therapy for inflammatory bowel disease and potentially multiple other indications.

title: Consumer Confidence Index
description: The Consumer Confidence data, which is published by the Cabinet Office, indicates individuals' feelings and attitudes towards the state of the economy. When consumer confidence is high, it tends to encourage economic growth, while low consumer confidence often leads to economic decline. Typically, a reading above 50 is considered positive or optimistic for the JPY (Japanese Yen), while a reading below 50 is seen as negative or pessimistic.

By Ben Glickman
Merck and Daiichi Sankyo agreed to jointly develop and commercialize three potential cancer treatments in a deal worth up to $22 billion.

news.headline: Japan's Overall Consumer Inflation Rose 3% in September
news.body:
By Megumi Fujikawa
TOKYO--Japan's overall consumer prices rose 3% from a year earlier in September, government data showed Friday.

news.headline: US Futures Flat, European Stocks Slip
news.body: U.S. futures for the S&P 500 were flat and futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average were flat. Changes in futures do not necessarily predict movements after the opening bell.

title: Retail Sales (YoY)
description: The Netherlands Statistics Office releases data on retail sales, which measures the fluctuations in the sales of the retail industry in the Netherlands. This data provides insights into the industry's performance in the near future. The percentage change indicates the rate of sales growth or decline. Retail sales data is closely watched as an indicator of consumer spending. A higher index is seen as a positive trend for the EUR, while a lower index suggests a negative trend for the EUR.

news.headline: Airbus Gets Support Contract for UK Military Satellite System
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Airbus said it was awarded a U.K. Ministry of Defence contract to provide support for a military satellite communications system.

news.headline: Universal Music Shares Plunge After Streaming Growth Disappoints
news.body: Shares of Universal Music Group slumped in Friday morning trading after revenue growth from streaming came below analysts' expectations for the third quarter.

news.headline: Universal Music Posts Higher Revenue as Subscriptions, Physical Sales Pick Up -- Update
news.body: Universal Music Group posted higher revenue for the third quarter thanks to subscriptions and streaming as well as physical sales, particularly in the U.S. and Europe.

news.headline: Universal Music Posts Higher Revenue as Subscriptions, Physical Sales Pick Up
news.body: Universal Music Group posted higher revenue for the third quarter thanks to subscriptions and streaming as well as physical sales, particularly in the U.S. and Europe.

news.headline: Unilever CEO Sets Out New Plan to Simplify Business, Rebuild Margins -- At a Glance
news.body: Unilever's new CEO Hein Schumacher on Thursday outlined a plan to tackle part of the business underperformance and simplify it in order to achieve the board's middle-term targets through production optimization and focusing investments.

news.headline: Trending: Unilever Sets Out Action Plan to Address Underperformance
news.body: 1011 GMT - Unilever is the second-most mentioned company across news items over the past two hours, according to Factiva data. The Anglo-Dutch retailer--which owns consumer brands such as Ben & Jerry's ice cream and Dove soap--set out on Thursday an action plan to address underperformance by focusing on its most profitable brands, simplified productivity and performance-oriented leadership. The new plan was announced after the group reported a mainly price-driven 3Q sales growth--while volumes fell--and backed its 2023 guidance. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (michael.susin@wsj.com)

news.headline: Unilever CEO Outlines Shake-up Plans to Boost Performance After 3Q Sales Beat Views -- 2nd Update
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Unilever's new chief executive, Hein Schumacher, outlined plans aimed at remedying some of the group's underperformance while the company backed its full-year guidance after third-quarter sales slipped by less than feared.

news.headline: Unilever's New CEO Sets Out Plan to Improve Performance After 3Q Sales Drop -- Update
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Unilever's new chief executive, Hein Schumacher, set out a plan for the coming years aimed at remedying some of the group's underperformance as it reported a fall in third-quarter sales but backed its full-year guidance.

news.headline: Leapmotor Shares Fall After Stellantis Takes Stake in EV Maker for $1.58 Billion
news.body:
By Jiahui Huang
Zhejiang Leapmotor Technology's shares were lower at the mid-day break after initially rising on news of a 1.5 billion euro ($1.58 billion) investment by Stellantis in the Chinese electric-vehicle maker.

news.headline: Stellantis Invests EUR1.5 Billion in Chinese EV Company Leapmotor
news.body:
By Ben Glickman
Stellantis has invested EUR1.5 billion ($1.58 billion) in Chinese electric-vehicle business Leapmotor as the automaker seeks to expand global sales through a joint venture.

news.headline: Airbus to Charter New Low-Emission Vessels for Transatlantic Parts Shipments -- OPIS
news.body: Airbus will charter a fleet of three new low-emission ships to transport aircraft subassemblies between production facilities in Europe and in the U.S., the company said Wednesday.

news.headline: Stellantis Close to Buying 20% of Chinese EV Company Leapmotor, Bloomberg Reports
news.body: -- Stellantis is nearing a deal to buy around 20% of Zhejiang Leapmotor Technology, a Chinese electric-vehicle maker, Bloomberg reported citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: Shell Cuts 200 Jobs From Low-Carbon Solutions Unit
news.body:
By Christian Moess Laursen
Shell plans to cut around 200 jobs at its low-carbon solutions division in 2024 as part of its efforts to simplify the business structure, the energy giant said Wednesday.

news.headline: Orange, MasMovil Plan to Sell Spain Assets to Digi Over EU Concerns, Reuters Reports
news.body: --Orange and MasMovil plan to sell assets to address European Union authorities' competition concerns over their proposed combination in Spain and picked Romania's Digi Communications as the buyer, Reuters reports, citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: European Fintech Shares Plunge on Economic Slowdown Concerns
news.body: Shares of companies operating in the European fintech industry slumped on Wednesday after France's Worldline warned of a slowdown in the German market, long regarded as the economic powerhouse of the continent.

news.headline: Heineken Backs 2023 Views Despite Seeing Weakening Consumer Demand -- Update
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Heineken backed its full-year guidance after third-quarter revenue slightly missed market expectations, as the group focus on improving business performance amid a slowing consumer demand.

news.headline: Heineken Backs 2023 Guidance After 3Q Revenue Rose But Missed Expectations
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Heineken backed its full-year guidance after reporting a third-quarter revenue increase that was slightly below market expectations.

news.headline: Stellantis Renews Commercial Van Lineup
news.body: Stellantis shared a new lineup of commercial vans for its Citroen, Fiat Professional, Opel, Peugeot and Vauxhall brands as it seeks to double commercial-vehicle revenue by the end of the decade.

news.headline: Airbus Teams Up With Northrop Grumman in Bid for UK Military Satellite Program
news.body: Airbus is partnering with Northrop Grumman in its bid for a U.K. program aimed at developing a new constellation of military communications satellites for the country's armed forces.

news.headline: Airbus Signs EUR1.2 Billion in Contracts for French A330 MRTT Fleet
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Airbus said that it has signed capability-enhancement and in-service support contracts for the French A330 Multi Role Tanker Transport fleet worth 1.2 billion euros ($1.27 billion).

title: Consumer Spending (MoM)
description: The INSEE's Consumer Spending is a measure of the total spending by individuals. It can be used to gauge consumer confidence. A high reading is good for the EUR currency, while a low reading is viewed as unfavorable.

news.body:

Shares of Sanofi fell sharply after the company warned it expects business earnings for next year to be hit by its plans to boost investment in research and development and changes in global tax regulations.

news.headline: Sanofi Backs Guidance After Earnings, Sales Miss Views
news.body:

Sanofi confirmed its 2023 guidance after it reported business earnings and sales that came in slightly below consensus forecasts, with currency headwinds offsetting a strong launch of its Beyfortus vaccine.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Split Consumer-Healthcare, Pharma Businesses -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi plans to split its consumer-healtchare and pharmaceutical operations, making it the latest big drugmaker to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Spin Off Consumer-Healthcare Business
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi said it plans to spin off its consumer-healthcare unit into a publicly listed entity, making it the latest pharmaceutical giant to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.body: Safran confirmed its forecasts for the year after revenue jumped in the third quarter as air traffic for narrowbody jets translated into strong demand for spare parts.

news.body:

Vinci backed its 2023 guidance and lifted its free cash flow outlook for the year after third-quarter revenue rose.

news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
TotalEnergies' profit rose in the third quarter of the year boosted by higher oil prices and refining margins, while shareholder distribution is in line with the company's recently upgraded strategy.

news.headline: Correction to TotalEnergies Article
news.body: The company will distribute a third interim dividend of 74 European cents a share for 2023. "TotalEnergies Posts Higher 3Q Profit, Increases Dividend," at 0636 GMT, incorrectly said the third interim dividend amounted to 0.74 European cents a share.

news.headline: STMicroelectronics Shares Fall After Guidance Disappoints
news.body: STMicroelectronics shares fell Thursday after the European chip maker set guidance below analysts' expectations for the fourth quarter and slightly tweaked its forecasts for the year.

news.headline: Schneider Electric Shares Fall After Flat 3Q Sales
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Schneider Electric sales fell on Thursday after the French energy-management and automation group posted third-quarter revenue that was largely flat on year, missing expectations.

title: Import Price Index (YoY)
description: The Import Price Index, reported by the Federal Statistical Office (Destatis), tracks the fluctuations in prices of goods brought into Germany. This index is valuable in distinguishing between changes in the quantity of trade and changes in trade prices. An increase in import volume indicates higher consumer demand and economic growth, while an increase in import prices implies rising production expenses and inflationary pressures.

news.headline: German Business Sentiment Ticked Up in October on Renewed Optimism -- Update
news.body:

Business sentiment in Germany improved in October, snapping five consecutive months of declines, as firms in the manufacturing, services and construction sectors became more optimistic on future expectations.

title: Import Price Index (MoM)
description: The Import Price Index, which is reported by the Federal Statistical Office (Destatis), tracks the fluctuations in prices for goods that are brought into Germany. This index is significant because it helps differentiate between changes in trade volume and changes in trade prices. When the import volume grows, it indicates increased consumer demand and economic growth. On the other hand, when import prices increase, it signifies higher production costs and inflationary pressures.

title: Trade Balance
description: The TurkStat Trade Balance represents the balance between the total goods and services exported and imported. A trade surplus is indicated by a positive value, while a negative value indicates a trade deficit. If there is a consistent demand for Turkish exports, the Lira will be positively impacted, but a decrease in demand is seen as negative.

news.headline: Preview -- Barron's
news.body:
Wednesday 11/1
The Bureau of Labor Statistics releases the Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey for September. There were 9.61 million job openings on the last business day of August, down from a peak of just over 12 million in March of 2022, but still well above historical averages.

news.headline: Coherus BioSciences Shares Climb 12% on FDA Approval for Cancer Treatment Loqtorzi
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Shares of Coherus BioSciences climbed 12% to $2.96 in after-hours trading after the company said the Food and Drug Administration approved Loqtorzi to treat nasopharyngeal cancer when used with chemotherapy.

news.headline: Wells Fargo Vice Chairman Thomas Nides to Leave Co., Turn Attention to Middle East
news.body:

Wells Fargo said Vice Chairman Thomas Nides, the former U.S. Ambassador to Israel, will leave the company, effective immediately, to return his attention to events unfolding in the Middle East.

news.headline: Trending: Some Analysts Raise Intel Price Target
news.body: 14:37 -- Intel is one of the most mentioned companies in the U.S. across all news items in the last 12 hours, according to Factiva data. Some analysts, including HSBC and Morgan Stanley, raised their price targets on Intel stock Friday, after the company reported third-quarter financial results that came in better than estimates. The stock is enjoying one of its best days in a year on Friday. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (stephen.nakrosis@wsj.com)

description: The INSEE's Producer Price Index tracks the average price changes of commodities produced in various stages in the French market. news.headline: Airbus Gets Support Contract for UK Military Satellite System
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Airbus said it was awarded a U.K. Ministry of Defence contract to provide support for a military satellite communications system.

news.headline: Sanofi Shares Tumble After Warning of Profit Hit From Investment, Taxes
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of Sanofi fell sharply after the company warned it expects business earnings for next year to be hit by its plans to boost investment in research and development and changes in global tax regulations.

news.headline: Sanofi Backs Guidance After Earnings, Sales Miss Views
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi confirmed its 2023 guidance after it reported business earnings and sales that came in slightly below consensus forecasts, with currency headwinds offsetting a strong launch of its Beyfortus vaccine.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Split Consumer-Healthcare, Pharma Businesses -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi plans to split its consumer-healtchare and pharmaceutical operations, making it the latest big drugmaker to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Spin Off Consumer-Healthcare Business
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi said it plans to spin off its consumer-healthcare unit into a publicly listed entity, making it the latest pharmaceutical giant to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.headline: Safran Backs Guidance After Revenue Boost
news.body: Safran confirmed its forecasts for the year after revenue jumped in the third quarter as air traffic for narrowbody jets translated into strong demand for spare parts.

news.headline: Groupe SEB Foresees Negative Hit From Euro Appreciation -- Currency Comment
news.body:
By Paulo Trevisani
Groupe SEB said it anticipates a negative impact on sales from the appreciation of the euro.

news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Vinci backed its 2023 guidance and lifted its free cash flow outlook for the year after third-quarter revenue rose.

news.headline: TotalEnergies 3Q Profit Boosted by Higher Oil Prices, Refining Margins -- Update
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
TotalEnergies' profit rose in the third quarter of the year boosted by higher oil prices and refining margins, while shareholder distribution is in line with the company's recently upgraded strategy.

news.headline: Correction to TotalEnergies Article
news.body: The company will distribute a third interim dividend of 74 European cents a share for 2023. "TotalEnergies Posts Higher 3Q Profit, Increases Dividend," at 0636 GMT, incorrectly said the third interim dividend amounted to 0.74 European cents a share.

news.headline: STMicroelectronics Shares Fall After Guidance Disappoints
news.body: STMicroelectronics shares fell Thursday after the European chip maker set guidance below analysts' expectations for the fourth quarter and slightly tweaked its forecasts for the year.

news.headline: BNP Paribas Shares Slip After Profit Fall, French Retail Bank Weakness
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of BNP Paribas fell after the lender reported a lower net profit for the third quarter and said earnings at its French retail-banking operations slipped.

news.headline: Schneider Electric Shares Fall After Flat 3Q Sales
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Schneider Electric sales fell on Thursday after the French energy-management and automation group posted third-quarter revenue that was largely flat on year, missing expectations.

news.headline: Danone Lifts Sales Growth Guidance on Improving Volume, Mix
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Danone raised its full-year sales growth guidance after recording a sequential improvement in volume/mix in sales in the third quarter.

news.headline: Leapmotor Shares Fall After Stellantis Takes Stake in EV Maker for $1.58 Billion
news.body:
By Jiahui Huang
Zhejiang Leapmotor Technology's shares were lower at the mid-day break after initially rising on news of a 1.5 billion euro ($1.58 billion) investment by Stellantis in the Chinese electric-vehicle maker.

news.headline: Schneider Electric Backs 2023 Targets After Flat Third-Quarter Revenue
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Schneider Electric has backed its full-year outlook after reporting flattish third-quarter revenue that was just shy of analysts' expectations.

title: Consumer Price Index (EU norm) (MoM)
description: The INSEE's Consumer Price Index is used to track changes in prices by comparing the retail prices of a standard set of goods and services. Inflation has a negative effect on the purchasing power of the Euro. The CPI is an important tool for measuring inflation and changes in consumer buying habits. In general, a higher CPI is viewed as beneficial for the Euro, while a lower CPI is seen as unfavorable.

title: Foreign Arrivals
description: The Foreign Arrivals data published by TurkStat monitors the quantity of tourists coming to Turkey. Since the tourism sector plays a significant role in the country's total GDP, the number of arrivals serves as a crucial gauge of the overall economic situation. Usually, a high figure is considered favorable (or bullish) for the value of the Lira, whereas a low figure is seen as unfavorable (or bearish).

news.headline: Preview -- Barron's
news.body:
Wednesday 11/1
The Bureau of Labor Statistics releases the Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey for September. There were 9.61 million job openings on the last business day of August, down from a peak of just over 12 million in March of 2022, but still well above historical averages.

news.headline: Coherus BioSciences Shares Climb 12% on FDA Approval for Cancer Treatment Loqtorzi
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Shares of Coherus BioSciences climbed 12% to $2.96 in after-hours trading after the company said the Food and Drug Administration approved Loqtorzi to treat nasopharyngeal cancer when used with chemotherapy.

news.headline: Wells Fargo Vice Chairman Thomas Nides to Leave Co., Turn Attention to Middle East
news.body:
By Stephen Nakrosis
Wells Fargo said Vice Chairman Thomas Nides, the former U.S. Ambassador to Israel, will leave the company, effective immediately, to return his attention to events unfolding in the Middle East.

news.headline: Intuitive Machines Sets January Date for NASA Lunar Mission
news.body:
By Stephen Nakrosis
Intuitive Machines said its IM-1 lunar mission, an attempted lunar landing as part of a National Aeronautics and Space Administration initiative, will take place in January of next year.

news.headline: Morgan Stanley Awards Next CEO, Other Candidates Awards Valued at $20 Million
news.body:

Morgan Stanley issued stock-based awards to its next chief executive officer and other leaders who were in the running for the top job.

news.headline: Trending: Some Analysts Raise Intel Price Target
news.body: 14:37 -- Intel is one of the most mentioned companies in the U.S. across all news items in the last 12 hours, according to Factiva data. Some analysts, including HSBC and Morgan Stanley, raised their price targets on Intel stock Friday, after the company reported third-quarter financial results that came in better than estimates. The stock is enjoying one of its best days in a year on Friday. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (stephen.nakrosis@wsj.com)

title: Current Account Balance
description: The Bank of Spain releases a report called the Current Account, which shows the overall movement of goods, services, and interest payments in and out of Spain. If there is a current account deficit, it means that more money is leaving Spain than coming in. A high reading of the Current Account is considered positive for the Euro, while a low reading is seen as negative.

news.headline: CaixaBank's 3Q Profit Boosted by Higher Lending Income
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
CaixaBank reported a rise in third-quarter profit on higher lending income despite a decline in its loans portfolio.

news.headline: Spain Keeps Adding Jobs as Tourists Visit En Masse -- Update
news.body:
By Joshua Kirby
Spain employed more people than ever before between July and September, thanks in large part to a resurgent tourism sector that has boosted the country's jobs market.

news.headline: Spanish Jobless Rate Remained Largely Stable Over the Summer
news.body:
By Joshua Kirby
Spain's unemployment rate stabilized in the third quarter, boosted by a resurgent tourism sector.

news.headline: Iberdrola Raises Guidance After Earnings Jump
news.body:
Iberdrola lifted its profit guidance for the year after posting higher earnings for the first nine months.
The Spanish energy company on Thursday reported net profit of 3.64 billion euros ($3.85 billion), up from EUR3.10 billion in the first nine months of last year.

news.headline: Orange, MasMovil Plan to Sell Spain Assets to Digi Over EU Concerns, Reuters Reports
news.body: --Orange and MasMovil plan to sell assets to address European Union authorities' competition concerns over their proposed combination in Spain and picked Romania's Digi Communications as the buyer, Reuters reports, citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: Masdar to Buy Stake in Iberdrola's East Anglia 3 Wind Farm, Cinco Dias Reports
news.body: --Abu Dhabi's Masdar is set to buy a 49% stake in Spanish utility Iberdrola's wind project, known as East Anglia 3, off the Suffolk coast in the Southern North Sea, Cinco Dias reports, citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: FTSE 100 Holds Steady on Energy Companies Though Israeli Stocks, Airlines Slump -- Market Talk
news.body: Energean shares fall after Hamas's attack on Israel as the company, which is developing a substantial gas field offshore Israel, faces uncertainty, AJ Bell writes. While the FTSE 100 was steady on Monday--supported by oil heavyweights BP and Shell--, Energean shares are down 19%, languishing among London's worst performers, alongside fellow Israeli-based companies BATM Advanced Communications and MTI Wireless Edge, both down 8.5% and 11%, respectively. Airlines also fell as the market priced in higher fuel costs and, potentially, less willingness to travel to certain locations, AJ Bell's investment director Russ Mould says, with International Consolidated Airlines Group, Ryanair, Wizz Air and easyJet all falling 5.3%, 3.0%, 5.1% and 5.5%, respectively. (joseph.hoppe@wsj.com)

news.headline: European Defense, Energy Stocks Rise, Airlines Slide After Attack on Israel
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
European defense and energy stocks rose Monday, while airline stocks fell after the surprise attack by Hamas on southern Israel over the weekend.

news.headline: Sanofi, Janssen Team Up to Develop, Commercialize Vaccine for E. Coli
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi and Johnson & Johnson's Janssen Pharmaceuticals have entered into an agreement to jointly develop and commercialize a vaccine candidate against extraintestinal pathogenic Escherichia coli, a cause of bacterial infections.

news.headline: European Telecom CEOs Call on EU to Make Tech Companies Pay for Networks
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
European telecommunications companies urged the European Union to overhaul the industry's regulatory framework and make big technology companies contribute to fund the costs of network infrastructure.

news.headline: Trending: BBVA Launches Second Extraordinary Share Buyback in Two Years
news.body: 1127 GMT - Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria is among the most mentioned companies across news items over the past 12 hours, according to Factiva data, after the Spanish bank said it will begin buying back shares as of Monday. The bank said that it received authorization to launch a 1 billion euro ($1.06 billion) share buyback program. The bank intends to acquire 564.6 million shares during the buyback which is scheduled to end no later than Sept. 21 of next year, the bank said. The European Central Bank green-lit the buyback plan which was disclosed back in July. This is the bank's second extraordinary buyback over the last two years. In April BBVA finished a EUR422 million buyback and in August 2022 it completed a EUR3.16 billion buyback. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (pierre.bertrand@wsj.com)

news.headline: BBVA to Launch $1.1 Billion Buyback After ECB Approval
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria is launching a share buyback program of up to 1 billion euros ($1.06 billion) after it received authorization from the European Central Bank.

title: Consumer Price Index (MoM)
description: The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a tool used by Statistics Portugal to track changes in prices. It compares the retail prices of a representative selection of goods and services to measure inflation. When inflation is high, the purchasing power of the Euro (EUR) decreases. The CPI is an important indicator for measuring both inflation and changes in consumer spending habits. A high CPI reading is generally seen as good for the EUR, while a low reading is seen as bad.

news.headline: Nordic Stocks Dropped Friday; Truecaller Series B Took Biggest Hit

title: Gross Domestic Product (YoY)
description: The Gross Domestic Product (GDP), which is published by Statistics Portugal, is a way of calculating the total worth of all the things that Portugal produces. It is a useful indicator of how well the economy is doing. When the GDP is increasing, it is generally seen as a good sign for the Euro (EUR) currency. On the other hand, if the GDP is decreasing, it is considered to be a negative or bearish trend.

news.headline: Nordic Stocks Dropped Friday; Truecaller Series B Took Biggest Hit
news.body:
Nordic stocks declined Friday, with the OMX Nordic 40 Index declining 0.9%.
Truecaller AB Series B posted the largest decline during the session, cratering 31.9%, followed by Electrolux Professional AB Series B shares, which plunged 17.8%. Shares of Electrolux AB Series B tumbled 13.6%.

news.headline: Agnico Eagle Expects 2023 Production at High End of Guidance After Finland Mine's Permit Restored
news.body:
By Robb M. Stewart
Agnico Eagle Mines expects production for the year to come in toward the upper end of its target after a court in Finland restored the gold producer's operating permit for its Kittila mine in the country's north, allowing it to operate at a higher capacity.

news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
UniCredit shareholders have given their approval for the Italian bank to buyback up to 2.5 billion euros worth ($2.64 billion) of shares.

news.body:

Airbus said it was awarded a U.K. Ministry of Defence contract to provide support for a military satellite communications system.

news.headline: Universal Music Shares Plunge After Streaming Growth Disappoints
news.body: Shares of Universal Music Group slumped in Friday morning trading after revenue growth from streaming came below analysts' expectations for the third quarter.

news.headline: Sanofi Shares Tumble After Warning of Profit Hit From Investment, Taxes
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of Sanofi fell sharply after the company warned it expects business earnings for next year to be hit by its plans to boost investment in research and development and changes in global tax regulations.

news.headline: Sanofi Backs Guidance After Earnings, Sales Miss Views
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi confirmed its 2023 guidance after it reported business earnings and sales that came in slightly below consensus forecasts, with currency headwinds offsetting a strong launch of its Beyfortus vaccine.

news.headline: Eni Raises Guidance After 3Q Beat Expectations Despite Weaker Prices
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Eni raised its full-year operating profit guidance after third-quarter results beat analysts' expectations, boosted by the exploration and production division.

news.headline: Siemens Acquisition of Heliox Faces UK Competition Probe
news.body:
By Michael Susin
The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority said it has launched an investigation regarding the acquisition of Heliox by a Siemens subsidiary.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Split Consumer-Healthcare, Pharma Businesses -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi plans to split its consumer-healtchare and pharmaceutical operations, making it the latest big drugmaker to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.headline: CaixaBank's 3Q Profit Boosted by Higher Lending Income
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
CaixaBank reported a rise in third-quarter profit on higher lending income despite a decline in its loans portfolio.

news.body:

Sanofi said it plans to spin off its consumer-healthcare unit into a publicly listed entity, making it the latest pharmaceutical giant to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Novartis said that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has classified the Pluvicto drug shortage status as resolved, and that supply availability should continue to increase into 2024.

news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding said it received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for Vabysmo as treatment of macular edema following retinal vein occlusion, the drug's third indication.

news.body: Safran confirmed its forecasts for the year after revenue jumped in the third quarter as air traffic for narrowbody jets translated into strong demand for spare parts.

title: Gross Domestic Product (QoQ)
description: The Gross Domestic Product (GDP) report from Statistics Portugal provides an assessment of the overall value of goods and services produced in Portugal using the expenditure approach. The GDP is generally used as a comprehensive gauge of economic activity and well-being. When the GDP shows an increasing trend, it generally has a positive impact on the EUR. Conversely, a decreasing trend is viewed as negative or bearish for the EUR.

title: Consumer Price Index (YoY)
description: The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a tool used by Statistics Portugal to track the changes in prices of a variety of goods and services. It helps determine the purchasing power of the Euro (EUR), as inflation can affect its value. The CPI is an important gauge for measuring inflation and shifts in consumer spending habits. title: Retail Sales (YoY)
description: The Retail Sales data, provided by the National Statistics Service, tracks the sales activity in the retail sector of Greece. It serves as an indicator of how well the retail sector is performing in the short term. The percent changes in sales reflect the rate at which these sales are changing. This data is closely watched as it provides insights into consumer spending. A high reading is considered positive or bullish for the Euro, while a low reading is seen as negative or bearish.

title: Consumer Price Index (EU Norm) (MoM)
description: The EU Norm Inflation released by the Istituto Nazionale di Statistica is a standardized way of measuring price changes in EU countries. It is similar to the national Consumer Price Indices (CPI) but includes items like personal computers, new cars, and airfares, while excluding housing costs and council tax. Typically, a high reading is considered good for the euro, while a low reading is considered bad.

title: 10-y Bond Auction
description: The calendar shows the average return on the Buoni del Tesoro Poliannuali (BTP) bonds that are auctioned by the Ministry of Economy and Finance. These Italian bonds have different maturities, ranging from three to thirty years. The yield on the BTP bonds represents the amount of money an investor will earn by holding the bond until it reaches maturity. Investors keep an eye on the yield volatility and compare the average rate at each auction to the rates of previous auctions for the same bonds. This helps them evaluate the government's debt situation.

title: Producer Price Index (MoM)
description: The Producer Price Index (PPI) is a measure of the average price changes in the primary markets of Italy, specifically for commodities produced at different stages of processing. It is released by the National Institute of Statistics. The PPI is closely monitored as it provides insights into commodity inflation. In general, a high PPI reading is considered positive or bullish for the Euro, while a low reading is seen as negative or bearish.

title: Redbook Index (YoY)
description: The Johnson Redbook Index, which is published by Redbook Research Inc., measures the annual growth in sales for the same stores in a sample group of major US general merchandise retailers. This index is weighted based on sales volume and represents approximately 9,000 stores. In terms of monetary value, the index accounts for over 80% of the official retail sales figures collected and published by the US Department of Commerce.

news.headline: Preview -- Barron's
news.body:
Wednesday 11/1
The Bureau of Labor Statistics releases the Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey for September. There were 9.61 million job openings on the last business day of August, down from a peak of just over 12 million in March of 2022, but still well above historical averages.

news.headline: Coherus BioSciences Shares Climb 12% on FDA Approval for Cancer Treatment Loqtorzi
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Shares of Coherus BioSciences climbed 12% to $2.96 in after-hours trading after the company said the Food and Drug Administration approved Loqtorzi to treat nasopharyngeal cancer when used with chemotherapy.

news.headline: Wells Fargo Vice Chairman Thomas Nides to Leave Co., Turn Attention to Middle East
news.body:
By Stephen Nakrosis
Wells Fargo said Vice Chairman Thomas Nides, the former U.S. Ambassador to Israel, will leave the company, effective immediately, to return his attention to events unfolding in the Middle East.

news.headline: Intuitive Machines Sets January Date for NASA Lunar Mission
news.body:
By Stephen Nakrosis
Intuitive Machines said its IM-1 lunar mission, an attempted lunar landing as part of a National Aeronautics and Space Administration initiative, will take place in January of next year.

news.headline: Morgan Stanley Awards Next CEO, Other Candidates Awards Valued at $20 Million
news.body:
By Denny Jacob
Morgan Stanley issued stock-based awards to its next chief executive officer and other leaders who were in the running for the top job.

news.headline: Tupperware Brands Loses PcW as Auditor
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Tupperware Brands said PricewaterhouseCoopers isn't willing to stand for reappointment as its accounting firm, according to a Securities and Exchange Commission filing.

title: S&P/Case-Shiller Home Price Indices (YoY)
description: The S&P/Case-Shiller Home Price Indices, published by Standard & Poor's, analyze the fluctuations in residential real estate market values in 20 regions across the United States. This report is used as a gauge for the overall condition of the US housing market. Typically, a higher reading is viewed as favorable or optimistic for the US dollar, whereas a lower reading is considered unfavorable or pessimistic.

title: 52-Week Bill Auction
description: The calendar shows the average return on the bonds sold by the US Department of Treasury. These bonds, called Treasury bills, are short-term investments that mature in one year or less. The return, or yield, on the bills indicates the profit that an investor will make by holding the bond until it matures. Investors track the volatility of the yield and compare the average rate at current auctions to previous auctions of the same type of bond. This helps them gauge the government's level of debt.

title: Building Permits s.a. (MoM)
description: The Statistics New Zealand has released data on Building Permits s.a., which tracks the amount of permits issued for new construction projects. This data is commonly used as an indicator for the state of the housing market. When there is a larger number of permits issued, it is seen as a positive sign (or bullish) for the NZD, while a smaller number of permits is seen as negative (or bearish).
