news.headline: CSL's Hemgenix Authorized by Health Canada as Gene Therapy for Hemophilia B
news.body:
By Robb M. Stewart
Australia biotechnology company CSL's Hemgenix has been authorized by Health Canada as the first gene therapy for the treatment of the rare bleeding disorder hemophilia B.

news.headline: Newmont 3Q Net Earnings Down, Sees Newcrest Deal Closing Nov 6
news.body:
By Rob Curran
Newmont posted lower third-quarter earnings due to lower gold production in the last profit update ahead of the mining giant's anticipated November closing of a major acquisition.

news.headline: Fortescue First-Quarter Shipments Down, Costs Up -- Update
news.body:
By Rhiannon Hoyle
Fortescue Metals Group on Thursday said first-quarter iron-ore shipments fell by 6% on-quarter and costs rose.

news.headline: Fortescue First-Quarter Shipments Down, Costs Up
news.body:
By Rhiannon Hoyle
Fortescue Metals Group on Thursday said first-quarter iron-ore shipments fell by 6% on-quarter and costs rose.

news.headline: Brambles Maintains Annual Guidance as 1Q Revenue Jumps on Price Rises
news.body:
By Stuart Condie
SYDNEY--Pallet supplier Brambles maintained its annual sales and profit guidance after price rises and easing lumber costs helped offset flat volumes in its fiscal first quarter.

news.headline: Coles Says First-Quarter Sales Revenue Rises, Inflation Moderates
news.body:
By Mike Cherney
SYDNEY--Australian grocer Coles, one of the country's main supermarket chains, said sales revenue in the fiscal first quarter rose 4.7% and that food-price inflation moderated overall.

news.headline: Westpac Flags A$173 Million Fiscal Year 2023 Profit Hit
news.body:
By Alice Uribe
Westpac Banking Corp has flagged that the company's reported net profit after tax for fiscal 2023 will be cut by 173 million Australian dollars (US$109.21 million) due to a range of notable items.

news.headline: Why the Shine Has Come Off Clean-Energy Stocks -- Commodities Roundup
news.body:
MARKET MOVEMENTS:
-- Brent crude oil is down 0.1% at $87.08 a barrel.

news.headline: Woolworths Group 1Q Group Sales Rise as Inflation Moderates
news.body:
By Alice Uribe
Australian grocer Woolworths Group said overall group sales increased in its fiscal first quarter, with customer trends consistent with the prior quarter and food prices continuing to moderate.

news.headline: Norsk Hydro's Renewables Company Gets $332 Million Investment From Macquarie
news.body:
By Dominic Chopping
Norsk Hydro said Tuesday that Macquarie Asset Management will invest $332 million in its Hydro Rein renewable energy company in return for a 49.9% stake.

news.headline: RBA Governor Bullock Sounds Hawkish Warning in First Speech
news.body: SYDNEY--Reserve Bank of Australia Gov. Michele Bullock sounded a hawkish warning to financial markets, saying the central bank won't have any patience if coming inflation data shows a material rise in price pressures across the economy.

news.headline: Anglo American Quarterly Copper Output Jumped; Coal and Diamond Fell Sharply -- Commodity Comment
news.body:
By Christian Moess Laursen
Anglo American reported a 4% rise in overall production in the third quarter, including a 42% jump in copper production. The increase also reflected a step-up from its steelmaking coal operations and operational improvements in the platinum group metals business. Here's what the diversified mining company had to say:

news.headline: Aterian, Rio Tinto Lithium Joint-Venture in Rwanda to Begin
news.body:
By Christian Moess Laursen
Aterian said its lithium-focused earn-in investment and joint-venture agreement in Rwanda with mining giant Rio Tinto is now effective, after Aterian met the required conditions.

news.headline: Microsoft Will Make Record Investment in Australia, Aims to Boost Cybersecurity
news.body:
By Mike Cherney
SYDNEY--Microsoft said it will make its largest-ever single investment in Australia and expand its cloud computing and AI infrastructure in the country while partnering with the Australian intelligence agency in charge of cybersecurity.

news.headline: South32's South Africa Manganese Unit Posts Record 1Q Output -- Commodity Comment
news.body: South32 on Monday reported higher output of manganese ore and alumina quarter-on-quarter, but said production of copper and metallurgical coal fell. Here are some remarks from the Australia-based miner's first-quarter report.

news.headline: South32 Begins Cost Review; Records Mixed 1Q Output
news.body:
By Rhiannon Hoyle
South32 said Monday it has started a group-wide cost review to help offset inflation pressures in the global mining industry, as it reported mixed first-quarter output across its commodities.

news.headline: Australia's Economy Added Fewer Jobs Than Expected in September
news.body:
By Stuart Condie
SYDNEY--Australia's economy added fewer jobs in September than economists had expected, potentially easing pressure on the Reserve Bank of Australia to raise interest rates next month.

news.headline: Santos Lifts 3Q Revenue 7% Amid Higher Commodity Prices
news.body:
By Stuart Condie
SYDNEY--Australian oil and gas producer Santos said sales revenue rose by 7% in the September quarter compared with the prior three months, reflecting higher crude-oil volumes and increased commodity prices for all its products.

title: Unemployment Rate
description: The Unemployment Rate in Japan is calculated by the Ministry of Health, Labour, and Welfare and published by the Japan Statistics Bureau. It represents the percentage of people who are unemployed in Japan. A higher rate suggests that the labor market is weak, which can impact the overall strength and direction of the Japanese economy. On the other hand, a lower rate is considered positive or bullish for the Japanese yen.

news.body:

Takeda Pharmaceutical shares fell sharply after it reported a second-quarter net loss due to impairments on certain products and cut its fiscal-year net-profit forecast.

Takeda Pharmaceutical reported a second-quarter net loss due to impairment losses on certain products and cut its net-profit forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2024.

news.headline: US Futures Down, European Stocks Mixed Ahead of ECB Rate Decision
news.body: U.S. futures for the S&P 500 were down 0.8% and futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 0.4%. Changes in futures do not necessarily predict movements after the opening bell.

news.headline: Takeda Pharmaceutical Books Second-Quarter Net Loss on Impairment of Certain Products
news.body:
By Kosaku Narioka
Takeda Pharmaceutical reported a second-quarter net loss due to impairment losses on certain products and cut its net-profit forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2024.

news.headline: Itochu Signs MOU With Orascom to Develop Ammonia Bunkering at Suez Canal -- OPIS
news.body: Japanese industrial giant Itochu has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with engineering firm Orascom Construction for the joint development of ammonia bunkering at the Suez Canal, Itochu said in a news release on Wednesday.

news.headline: Fuel Price Lock Program Boosts Sales for North American 7-Eleven Stores -- OPIS
news.body: A 7-Eleven Inc. program that allows members of the company's fuel rewards program to lock in a lower price for their next fuel purchase has almost doubled store visits by participating customers, according to parent Seven & I Holdings Co.

news.headline: Honda, GM Scrap Plan for Jointly Developed Line of Lower-Priced Electric Vehicles, Says Honda Spokesman
news.body:
By River Davis
TOKYO-General Motors and Honda Motor have decided that their plan to develop a line of lower-priced electric vehicles is not viable, a year and a half after the companies announced the joint effort, a Honda spokesman said Wednesday.

news.headline: Mitsubishi Motors to End Car Production in China
news.body:
By Kosaku Narioka
Mitsubishi Motors plans to end production of cars in China in response to sluggish sales amid stiff competition.

news.headline: Nidec Shares Slump After Drop in Quarterly Profit, Cut in EV Motor Sales Forecast
news.body:
By Kosaku Narioka
Nidec Corp. shares fell sharply after the Japanese electric-motor maker posted a drop in second-quarter net profit and lowered the annual sales forecast for electric-vehicle traction motors.

news.headline: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant, Pfizer in Deal Worth Up to $7.25 Billion -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding has agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in a deal worth up to $7.25 billion as the Swiss pharmaceutical giant seeks to bolster its immunology pipeline.

news.headline: AstraZeneca, Daiichi Sankyo's Enhertu Gets Approval in EU For Lung Cancer Treatment
news.body:
By Michael Susin
AstraZeneca said that its drug Enhertu, which it developed in partnership with Daiichi Sankyo, has been approved in the European Union for the treatment of advanced non-small cell lung cancer.

news.headline: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in $7.25 Billion Deal
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding has agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in a deal worth up to $7.25 billion that will give it rights to a therapy for inflammatory bowel disease and potentially multiple other indications.

title: Large Retailer Sales
description: The Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry publishes the Large Retailer Sales data, which represents the overall value of products sold in big stores, chain convenience stores, and supermarkets. This data is an important indicator of consumer spending and confidence. When Large Retailer Sales are high, it indicates a strong economy, while a low level suggests an economic decline. A positive report is beneficial for the value of the Japanese yen, while a negative report is seen as unfavorable.

title: Retail Trade (YoY)
description: The Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry collects data on the Retail Trade, which represents the total sales made by businesses primarily engaged in selling goods and services to the public for personal or household use. This information is crucial for understanding consumer spending, which is a significant factor in the Japanese economy. A high reading is beneficial for the Japanese yen (JPY), while a low reading is unfavorable.

title: Retail Sales (MoM)
description: The Retail Sales report, published by the Statistisches Bundesamt Deutschland, tracks changes in sales in the German retail industry. It provides insight into the sector's performance in the near future. Percentage changes indicate the rate of sales fluctuations, and are closely watched as an indicator of consumer spending. A higher reading typically suggests positive economic growth, which is considered favorable for the EUR currency. Conversely, a low reading is viewed as negative, or bearish, for the EUR.

news.body:

news.headline: German Business Sentiment Ticked Up in October on Renewed Optimism -- Update
news.body:

title: Real Retail Sales (YoY)
description: The Swiss Federal Statistical Office is responsible for conducting the Retail Sales survey. This survey measures the amount of goods that were sold in the previous month and is used to gauge consumer demand in Switzerland. The figures provided are adjusted for inflation and are not influenced by seasonal factors. Typically, a rise in these figures is considered positive for the CHF currency, while a decline is seen as negative.

news.headline: Trending: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant and Pfizer
news.body: 1504 ET -- Roche Holding and Pfizer are among the most mentioned companies in the U.S. across all news items in the last 12 hours, according to Factiva data. Roche agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer, a deal that includes $7.1 billion upfront and a near-term milestone payment of $150 million. Telavant is developing a bowel-disease treatment. On Friday, Pfizer said the Food and Drug Administration approved Penbraya, a vaccine for meningococcal disease. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (josh.beckerman@wsj.com)

title: Gross Domestic Product (YoY)
description: The National Institute of Statistics publishes data on the Gross Domestic Product (GDP), which measures the overall value of goods and services produced in Italy. title: Consumer Price Index (YoY)
description: The Istituto Nazionale di Statistica releases the Consumer Price Index to track changes in prices by comparing the retail prices of a representative selection of goods and services. Inflation reduces the purchasing power of the EUR. The CPI is important for measuring inflation and shifts in consumer purchasing habits. A higher CPI value is considered beneficial or optimistic for the EUR, whereas a lower value is viewed negatively.

title: Consumer Price Index (EU Norm) (YoY)
description: The EU Norm Inflation, published by the Istituto Nazionale di Statistica, is a standardized way of measuring price changes among EU countries. It is similar to national Consumer Price Indices, but it includes items like personal computers, new cars, and airfares while excluding housing costs and council tax. Typically, a higher reading is seen as a good thing for the euro, while a lower reading is seen as negative.

title: Gross Domestic Product (MoM)
description: The Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is a measure released by Statistics Canada that represents the total value of all goods and services produced in Canada. It is considered a comprehensive gauge of the country's economic activity and overall health. In general, when the GDP is increasing, it usually has a positive impact on the Canadian dollar (CAD), while a decreasing GDP is viewed as negative or bearish for the CAD.

title: Employment Cost Index
description: The Employment Cost Index (ECI) is a measure released by the US Bureau of Labour Statistics on a quarterly basis. It tracks the change in the cost of labor, specifically compensation per employee hour worked. This index is closely monitored by economists as it provides insight into cost pressures in companies, which may result in inflation for the prices of goods and services. The ECI includes not only changes in wages and salaries, but also a wide range of benefits.

news.body:

The Bureau of Labor Statistics releases the Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey for September. There were 9.61 million job openings on the last business day of August, down from a peak of just over 12 million in March of 2022, but still well above historical averages.

news.headline: Trending: Some Analysts Raise Intel Price Target
news.body: 14:37 -- Intel is one of the most mentioned companies in the U.S. across all news items in the last 12 hours, according to Factiva data. Some analysts, including HSBC and Morgan Stanley, raised their price targets on Intel stock Friday, after the company reported third-quarter financial results that came in better than estimates. The stock is enjoying one of its best days in a year on Friday. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (stephen.nakrosis@wsj.com)

title: Chicago Purchasing Managers' Index
description: The ISM-Chicago, Inc releases the Chicago Purchasing Managers Index, which measures business conditions in Illinois, Indiana, and Michigan. It is a reliable indicator of business trends and is closely connected to the ISM manufacturing Index. This index is commonly used to assess the overall economic situation in the United States. If the result is above 50, it is seen as positive for the USD, while a result below 50 is considered negative.

news.headline: Preview -- Barron's

title: Consumer Confidence
description: The Consumer Confidence index, released by the Conference Board, measures people's trust and optimism in the economy. When consumer confidence is high, it encourages economic growth, while low confidence contributes to an economic decline. In general, a high Consumer Confidence reading is favorable for the US dollar, while a low reading is unfavorable. Please note that due to restrictions imposed by the Conference Board, our Economic Calendar does not provide specific figures for this indicator.

description: Joachim Nagel became the President of the Deutsche Bundesbank on January 1, 2022, taking over from Jens Weidmann who stepped down. The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority said it has launched an investigation regarding the acquisition of Heliox by a Siemens subsidiary.

news.headline: Toxic Gas Leaks From BASF Ludwigshafen Complex After Operational Disruption -- OPIS
news.body: Toxic gas leaked from part of BASF's petrochemical complex in Ludwigshafen, Germany on Thursday, following what the company has called an operational disruption in a post to social media.

news.headline: Sweden Expects Budget Deficits in 2024-25; Maintains Previously Raised Bond-Issuance Targets
news.body:
By Emese Bartha
Sweden's central government budget balance has continued to develop more strongly than previously expected, with a surplus this year, but two years of deficits will follow, the National Debt Office said in its borrowing review on Thursday.

news.headline: Mercedes-Benz Shares Fall As Profit Drops, Headwinds Continue
news.body:
By David Sachs
Mercedes-Benz Group shares fell Thursday after the car maker reported a drop in third-quarter profit due to lower demand and currency effects, and warned that headwinds would continue for the rest of the year.

news.headline: Volkswagen Posts Higher After-Tax Profit in 3Q, Lower Production Rate
news.body:
By David Sachs
Volkswagen on Thursday posted higher-than-expected after-tax profit in the third quarter on a rise in vehicle sales, but production fell on year.

news.body:
By David Sachs
Mercedes-Benz reported lower third-quarter net profit and revenue after demand softened and foreign-exchange rates hurt its bottom line.

news.body: Airbus will charter a fleet of three new low-emission ships to transport aircraft subassemblies between production facilities in Europe and in the U.S., the company said Wednesday.

Hugo Boss has raised 175 million euros ($185.3 million) to finance further investments as part of its growth strategy 'CLAIM 5' aimed at accelerating growth across all brands, touchpoints and geographies.

news.headline: German Business Sentiment Ticked Up in October on Renewed Optimism -- Update
news.body:
By Ed Frankl
Business sentiment in Germany improved in October, snapping five consecutive months of declines, as firms in the manufacturing, services and construction sectors became more optimistic on future expectations.

news.headline: German Business Sentiment Ticked Up in October
news.body:
By Ed Frankl
Business sentiment in Germany improved in October, snapping five consecutive months of declines, as firms in the manufacturing, services and construction sectors became more encouraged by future expectations.

Uniper refined its full-year outlook on the back of a strong performance in the first nine months as it continued to benefit from hedging transactions tied to its power-generation and gas midstream businesses.

New York plans to invest $300 million in 25 renewable energy projects in what it said is the largest investment of its kind by any state in the U.S.

news.body:

Anglo American reported a 4% rise in overall production in the third quarter, including a 42% jump in copper production. The increase also reflected a step-up from its steelmaking coal operations and operational improvements in the platinum group metals business. Here's what the diversified mining company had to say:

news.body:

Aterian said its lithium-focused earn-in investment and joint-venture agreement in Rwanda with mining giant Rio Tinto is now effective, after Aterian met the required conditions.

news.body:

SYDNEY--Microsoft said it will make its largest-ever single investment in Australia and expand its cloud computing and AI infrastructure in the country while partnering with the Australian intelligence agency in charge of cybersecurity.

title: NBS Non-Manufacturing PMI
description: The non-manufacturing PMI, issued by the CFLP in China, is determined through a survey of approximately 1,200 companies across 27 industries such as construction, transport, and telecommunications. This index is based on the opinions of purchasing managers in the services industry and serves as a gauge for industry growth or decline. A reading above 50.0 signifies expansion, while a reading below indicates contraction.

title: NBS Manufacturing PMI

title: BoJ Interest Rate Decision
description: The Bank of Japan (BoJ) makes announcements on its interest rate decisions. In general, if the BoJ is optimistic about the economy and raises interest rates, it is seen as positive or bullish for the Japanese Yen (JPY). On the other hand, if the BoJ has a negative view of the economy and maintains or lowers interest rates, it is seen as negative or bearish.

title: Retail Sales (YoY)
description: The Retail Sales data provided by the German Federal Statistical Office measures the fluctuations in sales within the retail industry of Germany. This data is used to evaluate the performance of the retail sector in the near future. The percentage changes in retail sales indicate the rate at which sales are changing. These changes are closely monitored as an indicator of consumer spending. A higher percentage change is generally considered positive for the Euro (EUR), signaling anticipated economic growth, while a lower reading is viewed as negative (bearish) for the EUR.

title: Gross Domestic Product s.a. (QoQ)
description: The Eurostat's release of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) provides information about the total worth of goods and services produced in the Eurozone. The GDP is used as a general indicator of the Eurozone's economic activity and overall condition. Typically, an increasing GDP has a favorable impact on the value of the Euro (EUR), while a declining GDP is viewed as unfavorable (or bearish).

By Adria Calatayud
Siemens Energy is seeking state guarantees of up to 15 billion euros ($15.85 billion) as part of talks with the German government, according to people familiar with the matter.

news.headline: Toxic Gas Leaks From BASF Ludwigshafen Complex After Operational Disruption -- OPIS
news.body: Toxic gas leaked from part of BASF's petrochemical complex in Ludwigshafen, Germany on Thursday, following what the company has called an operational disruption in a post to social media.

news.headline: Sweden Expects Budget Deficits in 2024-25; Maintains Previously Raised Bond-Issuance Targets
news.body:
By Emese Bartha
Sweden's central government budget balance has continued to develop more strongly than previously expected, with a surplus this year, but two years of deficits will follow, the National Debt Office said in its borrowing review on Thursday.

news.headline: Mercedes-Benz Shares Fall As Profit Drops, Headwinds Continue
news.body:
By David Sachs
Mercedes-Benz Group shares fell Thursday after the car maker reported a drop in third-quarter profit due to lower demand and currency effects, and warned that headwinds would continue for the rest of the year.

title: Core Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (YoY)
description: Eurostat's Core Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (HICP) is a metric that tracks price fluctuations by comparing the retail prices of a typical basket of goods and services, but excludes items that tend to have volatile prices such as food, energy, alcohol, and tobacco. The Core HICP is an important gauge of inflation and shifts in consumer spending habits. In general, a higher reading is seen as a positive indication for the EUR, while a lower reading is viewed as negative.

title: Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (MoM)
description: Eurostat recently published the Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (HICP) for the Euro Zone, which tracks fluctuations in the cost of goods and services. This index serves as a crucial tool for gauging shifts in purchasing habits and inflation rates within the Euro Zone. Typically, a high HICP reading suggests a more aggressive stance, which bodes well for the performance of the EUR, while a low reading is viewed unfavorably.

title: Gross Domestic Product s.a. (YoY)
description: The Eurostat releases the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for the Eurozone, which measures the overall value of all goods and services produced in that region. The GDP serves as a general indicator of the economic activity and well-being of the Eurozone. Typically, an upward trend in GDP is seen as favorable and has a positive impact on the value of the Euro (EUR), while a downward trend is seen as unfavorable or bearish.

title: Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (YoY)
description: The Euro Zone Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (HICP), as reported by Eurostat, tracks the fluctuations in prices for goods and services. It is a valuable tool for measuring shifts in consumer behavior and inflation within the Euro Zone. Typically, a higher HICP indicates a more aggressive and positive outlook for the EUR currency, while a lower HICP is viewed as negative.

title: Core Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (MoM)
description: Eurostat, the organization responsible for collecting statistical data for the European Union, released the Core Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (HICP). This index measures how prices of goods and services in a representative shopping basket change over time, excluding volatile components like food, energy, alcohol, and tobacco. The Core HICP is an important tool for tracking inflation and changes in consumer spending patterns. Typically, a higher reading of the index is viewed as positive or favorable for the value of the EUR currency, while a lower reading is seen as negative.

news.body: Airbus will charter a fleet of three new low-emission ships to transport aircraft subassemblies between production facilities in Europe and in the U.S., the company said Wednesday.

news.headline: DAX Ends 0.08% Higher at 14892.18 -- Data Talk
news.body:
The DAX is up 12.24 points or 0.08% today to 14892.18
--Up for three consecutive trading days

news.headline: Hugo Boss Raises $185 Million for Investment Plan
news.body:
By Andrea Figueras
Hugo Boss has raised 175 million euros ($185.3 million) to finance further investments as part of its growth strategy 'CLAIM 5' aimed at accelerating growth across all brands, touchpoints and geographies.

news.headline: German Business Sentiment Ticked Up in October on Renewed Optimism -- Update
news.body:
By Ed Frankl
Business sentiment in Germany improved in October, snapping five consecutive months of declines, as firms in the manufacturing, services and construction sectors became more optimistic on future expectations.

news.headline: German Business Sentiment Ticked Up in October
news.body:
By Ed Frankl
Business sentiment in Germany improved in October, snapping five consecutive months of declines, as firms in the manufacturing, services and construction sectors became more encouraged by future expectations.

news.headline: Uniper Shares Rise After Hedging Activities Boost Performance
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Shares in Uniper rose on Wednesday after the bailed-out utility said hedging transactions boosted performance in the first nine months of the year and refined its outlook.

news.headline: Uniper Refines Full-Year Outlook as Hedging Boosts Nine-Month Results
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Uniper refined its full-year outlook on the back of a strong performance in the first nine months as it continued to benefit from hedging transactions tied to its power-generation and gas midstream businesses.

news.headline: Porsche AG Revenue, Operating Profit Rise; Return on Sales Slips
news.body:
By David Sachs
Porsche AG on Wednesday confirmed its 2023 guidance after reporting a jump in revenue and operating profit but a lower return on sales through the first nine months of the year.

news.headline: Beiersdorf Upgrades Sales Guidance After Strong Nine-Month Results
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Beiersdorf upgraded its sales guidance for the full year after recording a strong performance in the first nine months.

news.headline: New York to Make Largest-Ever State Investment in Renewable Energy
news.body:
By Adam L. Cataldo
New York plans to invest $300 million in 25 renewable energy projects in what it said is the largest investment of its kind by any state in the U.S.

title: Labour Cost Index (YoY)
description: The labour cost index (LCI) is a tool used by Statistics New Zealand to track changes in salary and wage rates for a specific amount and quality of labor. It does not include factors such as service increases, merit promotions, or individual performance-related changes in pay.

news.headline: S&P/ASX 200 Benchmark Index Falls 1.07% This Week to 6826.90 -- Data Talk
news.body:
The S&P/ASX 200 Benchmark Index is down 73.82 points or 1.07% this week to 6826.90
--Down for two consecutive weeks

news.headline: CSL's Hemgenix Authorized by Health Canada as Gene Therapy for Hemophilia B
news.body:
By Robb M. Stewart
Australia biotechnology company CSL's Hemgenix has been authorized by Health Canada as the first gene therapy for the treatment of the rare bleeding disorder hemophilia B.

news.headline: Newmont 3Q Net Earnings Down, Sees Newcrest Deal Closing Nov 6
news.body:
By Rob Curran
Newmont posted lower third-quarter earnings due to lower gold production in the last profit update ahead of the mining giant's anticipated November closing of a major acquisition.

news.headline: Fortescue First-Quarter Shipments Down, Costs Up -- Update
news.body:
By Rhiannon Hoyle
Fortescue Metals Group on Thursday said first-quarter iron-ore shipments fell by 6% on-quarter and costs rose.

news.headline: Fortescue First-Quarter Shipments Down, Costs Up
news.body:
By Rhiannon Hoyle
Fortescue Metals Group on Thursday said first-quarter iron-ore shipments fell by 6% on-quarter and costs rose.

news.headline: Brambles Maintains Annual Guidance as 1Q Revenue Jumps on Price Rises
news.body:
By Stuart Condie
SYDNEY--Pallet supplier Brambles maintained its annual sales and profit guidance after price rises and easing lumber costs helped offset flat volumes in its fiscal first quarter.

news.headline: Coles Says First-Quarter Sales Revenue Rises, Inflation Moderates
news.body:
By Mike Cherney
SYDNEY--Australian grocer Coles, one of the country's main supermarket chains, said sales revenue in the fiscal first quarter rose 4.7% and that food-price inflation moderated overall.

news.headline: Westpac Flags A$173 Million Fiscal Year 2023 Profit Hit
news.body:
By Alice Uribe
Westpac Banking Corp has flagged that the company's reported net profit after tax for fiscal 2023 will be cut by 173 million Australian dollars (US$109.21 million) due to a range of notable items.

news.headline: Why the Shine Has Come Off Clean-Energy Stocks -- Commodities Roundup
news.body:
MARKET MOVEMENTS:
-- Brent crude oil is down 0.1% at $87.08 a barrel.

news.headline: Woolworths Group 1Q Group Sales Rise as Inflation Moderates
news.body:
By Alice Uribe
Australian grocer Woolworths Group said overall group sales increased in its fiscal first quarter, with customer trends consistent with the prior quarter and food prices continuing to moderate.

news.headline: Norsk Hydro's Renewables Company Gets $332 Million Investment From Macquarie
news.body:
By Dominic Chopping
Norsk Hydro said Tuesday that Macquarie Asset Management will invest $332 million in its Hydro Rein renewable energy company in return for a 49.9% stake.

news.headline: RBA Governor Bullock Sounds Hawkish Warning in First Speech
news.body: SYDNEY--Reserve Bank of Australia Gov. Michele Bullock sounded a hawkish warning to financial markets, saying the central bank won't have any patience if coming inflation data shows a material rise in price pressures across the economy.

news.headline: Anglo American Quarterly Copper Output Jumped; Coal and Diamond Fell Sharply -- Commodity Comment
news.body:
By Christian Moess Laursen
Anglo American reported a 4% rise in overall production in the third quarter, including a 42% jump in copper production. The increase also reflected a step-up from its steelmaking coal operations and operational improvements in the platinum group metals business. Here's what the diversified mining company had to say:

news.headline: Aterian, Rio Tinto Lithium Joint-Venture in Rwanda to Begin
news.body:
By Christian Moess Laursen
Aterian said its lithium-focused earn-in investment and joint-venture agreement in Rwanda with mining giant Rio Tinto is now effective, after Aterian met the required conditions.

news.headline: Microsoft Will Make Record Investment in Australia, Aims to Boost Cybersecurity
news.body:
By Mike Cherney
SYDNEY--Microsoft said it will make its largest-ever single investment in Australia and expand its cloud computing and AI infrastructure in the country while partnering with the Australian intelligence agency in charge of cybersecurity.

news.headline: South32's South Africa Manganese Unit Posts Record 1Q Output -- Commodity Comment
news.body: South32 on Monday reported higher output of manganese ore and alumina quarter-on-quarter, but said production of copper and metallurgical coal fell. Here are some remarks from the Australia-based miner's first-quarter report.

news.headline: South32 Begins Cost Review; Records Mixed 1Q Output
news.body:
By Rhiannon Hoyle
South32 said Monday it has started a group-wide cost review to help offset inflation pressures in the global mining industry, as it reported mixed first-quarter output across its commodities.

news.headline: Australia's Economy Added Fewer Jobs Than Expected in September
news.body:
By Stuart Condie
SYDNEY--Australia's economy added fewer jobs in September than economists had expected, potentially easing pressure on the Reserve Bank of Australia to raise interest rates next month.

news.headline: Santos Lifts 3Q Revenue 7% Amid Higher Commodity Prices
news.body:
By Stuart Condie
SYDNEY--Australian oil and gas producer Santos said sales revenue rose by 7% in the September quarter compared with the prior three months, reflecting higher crude-oil volumes and increased commodity prices for all its products.

news.body:
By Robb M. Stewart
Agnico Eagle Mines expects production for the year to come in toward the upper end of its target after a court in Finland restored the gold producer's operating permit for its Kittila mine in the country's north, allowing it to operate at a higher capacity.

news.headline: UniCredit Shareholders Approve EUR2.5 Billion Buyback Plan
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
UniCredit shareholders have given their approval for the Italian bank to buyback up to 2.5 billion euros worth ($2.64 billion) of shares.

news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Airbus said it was awarded a U.K. Ministry of Defence contract to provide support for a military satellite communications system.

news.headline: Universal Music Shares Plunge After Streaming Growth Disappoints
news.body: Shares of Universal Music Group slumped in Friday morning trading after revenue growth from streaming came below analysts' expectations for the third quarter.

news.headline: Sanofi Shares Tumble After Warning of Profit Hit From Investment, Taxes
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of Sanofi fell sharply after the company warned it expects business earnings for next year to be hit by its plans to boost investment in research and development and changes in global tax regulations.

news.headline: Sanofi Backs Guidance After Earnings, Sales Miss Views
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi confirmed its 2023 guidance after it reported business earnings and sales that came in slightly below consensus forecasts, with currency headwinds offsetting a strong launch of its Beyfortus vaccine.

news.headline: Eni Raises Guidance After 3Q Beat Expectations Despite Weaker Prices
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Eni raised its full-year operating profit guidance after third-quarter results beat analysts' expectations, boosted by the exploration and production division.

news.headline: Siemens Acquisition of Heliox Faces UK Competition Probe
news.body:
By Michael Susin
The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority said it has launched an investigation regarding the acquisition of Heliox by a Siemens subsidiary.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Split Consumer-Healthcare, Pharma Businesses -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi plans to split its consumer-healtchare and pharmaceutical operations, making it the latest big drugmaker to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.headline: CaixaBank's 3Q Profit Boosted by Higher Lending Income
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
CaixaBank reported a rise in third-quarter profit on higher lending income despite a decline in its loans portfolio.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Spin Off Consumer-Healthcare Business
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi said it plans to spin off its consumer-healthcare unit into a publicly listed entity, making it the latest pharmaceutical giant to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.headline: Novartis Says FDA Deems Pluvicto Shortage Resolved, Supply Set to Increase Into 2024
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Novartis said that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has classified the Pluvicto drug shortage status as resolved, and that supply availability should continue to increase into 2024.

news.headline: Roche Gets FDA Approval for Vabysmo as Retinal Vein Occlusion Treatment
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding said it received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for Vabysmo as treatment of macular edema following retinal vein occlusion, the drug's third indication.

news.headline: Safran Backs Guidance After Revenue Boost
news.body: Safran confirmed its forecasts for the year after revenue jumped in the third quarter as air traffic for narrowbody jets translated into strong demand for spare parts.

title: Judo Bank Manufacturing PMI
description: Both the Commonwealth Bank of Australia and the S&P Global release the Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI), which measures business conditions in the manufacturing sector. Since the manufacturing sector holds a significant portion of the overall GDP in Australia, the Manufacturing PMI is a crucial indicator of business conditions and the overall economic situation in the country. A result above 50 suggests a positive outlook for the Australian dollar (AUD), while a result below 50 indicates a negative outlook.

title: AiG Construction PMI
description: The Australian Industry Group (AiG) releases the Construction PMI, which provides information about the state of the real estate industry in Australia. Spain employed more people than ever before between July and September, thanks in large part to a resurgent tourism sector that has boosted the country's jobs market.

Spain's unemployment rate stabilized in the third quarter, boosted by a resurgent tourism sector.

news.headline: Iberdrola Raises Guidance After Earnings Jump
news.body:
Iberdrola lifted its profit guidance for the year after posting higher earnings for the first nine months.
The Spanish energy company on Thursday reported net profit of 3.64 billion euros ($3.85 billion), up from EUR3.10 billion in the first nine months of last year.

news.headline: Orange, MasMovil Plan to Sell Spain Assets to Digi Over EU Concerns, Reuters Reports
news.body: --Orange and MasMovil plan to sell assets to address European Union authorities' competition concerns over their proposed combination in Spain and picked Romania's Digi Communications as the buyer, Reuters reports, citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: Santander Sees 2023 Targets on Track After Interest Income Boosts Profit
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Banco Santander said it remains on track to meet its 2023 targets after it reported a forecast-beating rise in net profit for the third quarter, with income from higher interest rates boosting its top line.

news.headline: Correction to Naturgy Article
news.body: Naturgy approved a second interim dividend for the year of 50 European cents a share. "Naturgy Raises 2023 Core Earnings Guidance on Higher Nine-Month Results," at 0727 GMT, incorrectly said the interim dividend was 5 European cents.

news.headline: Masdar to Buy Stake in Iberdrola's East Anglia 3 Wind Farm, Cinco Dias Reports
news.body: --Abu Dhabi's Masdar is set to buy a 49% stake in Spanish utility Iberdrola's wind project, known as East Anglia 3, off the Suffolk coast in the Southern North Sea, Cinco Dias reports, citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: Cellnex Names Raimon Trias Fita as CFO
news.body:
Cellnex Telecom appointed Raimon Trias Fita to succeed Jose Manuel Aisa Mancho as chief financial officer.
The Spanish wireless-telecommunications company said Monday that Trias Fita's appointment would be effective as of Dec. 1.

news.headline: Grenergy Sells Spain Solar Projects to Allianz for EUR270.6 Million
news.body:
By Helena Smolak
Grenergy Renovables said it agreed to sell two solar-energy projects in Spain to Allianz Capital Partners for 270.6 million euros ($286.2 million), and that proceeds will be used to fund future growth.

Spain hired banks for the syndicated launch of a new bond linked to eurozone HICP-ex tobacco, with maturity in November 2039, one of the lead manager banks said Monday.

news.headline: FTSE 100 Holds Steady on Energy Companies Though Israeli Stocks, Airlines Slump -- Market Talk
news.body: Energean shares fall after Hamas's attack on Israel as the company, which is developing a substantial gas field offshore Israel, faces uncertainty, AJ Bell writes. While the FTSE 100 was steady on Monday--supported by oil heavyweights BP and Shell--, Energean shares are down 19%, languishing among London's worst performers, alongside fellow Israeli-based companies BATM Advanced Communications and MTI Wireless Edge, both down 8.5% and 11%, respectively. Airlines also fell as the market priced in higher fuel costs and, potentially, less willingness to travel to certain locations, AJ Bell's investment director Russ Mould says, with International Consolidated Airlines Group, Ryanair, Wizz Air and easyJet all falling 5.3%, 3.0%, 5.1% and 5.5%, respectively. (joseph.hoppe@wsj.com)

news.headline: European Defense, Energy Stocks Rise, Airlines Slide After Attack on Israel
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
European defense and energy stocks rose Monday, while airline stocks fell after the surprise attack by Hamas on southern Israel over the weekend.

news.headline: Sanofi, Janssen Team Up to Develop, Commercialize Vaccine for E. Coli
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi and Johnson & Johnson's Janssen Pharmaceuticals have entered into an agreement to jointly develop and commercialize a vaccine candidate against extraintestinal pathogenic Escherichia coli, a cause of bacterial infections.

news.headline: European Telecom CEOs Call on EU to Make Tech Companies Pay for Networks
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
European telecommunications companies urged the European Union to overhaul the industry's regulatory framework and make big technology companies contribute to fund the costs of network infrastructure.

news.headline: Trending: BBVA Launches Second Extraordinary Share Buyback in Two Years
news.body: 1127 GMT - Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria is among the most mentioned companies across news items over the past 12 hours, according to Factiva data, after the Spanish bank said it will begin buying back shares as of Monday. The bank said that it received authorization to launch a 1 billion euro ($1.06 billion) share buyback program. The bank intends to acquire 564.6 million shares during the buyback which is scheduled to end no later than Sept. 21 of next year, the bank said. The European Central Bank green-lit the buyback plan which was disclosed back in July. This is the bank's second extraordinary buyback over the last two years. In April BBVA finished a EUR422 million buyback and in August 2022 it completed a EUR3.16 billion buyback. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (pierre.bertrand@wsj.com)

news.headline: BBVA to Launch $1.1 Billion Buyback After ECB Approval
news.body:

title: Building Permits (YoY)
description: The Australian Bureau of Statistics releases data known as Building Permits, which tracks the number of permits issued for new construction projects. This data reflects the level of corporate investments in the Australian economy, and consequently can affect the value of the Australian dollar (AUD) by creating fluctuations. If the number of permits is increasing, it is generally seen as a positive indicator for the AUD.

title: Jibun Bank Manufacturing PMI

news.headline: Unilever CEO Sets Out New Plan to Simplify Business, Rebuild Margins -- At a Glance
news.body: Unilever's new CEO Hein Schumacher on Thursday outlined a plan to tackle part of the business underperformance and simplify it in order to achieve the board's middle-term targets through production optimization and focusing investments.

news.headline: Trending: Unilever Sets Out Action Plan to Address Underperformance
news.body: 1011 GMT - Unilever is the second-most mentioned company across news items over the past two hours, according to Factiva data. The Anglo-Dutch retailer--which owns consumer brands such as Ben & Jerry's ice cream and Dove soap--set out on Thursday an action plan to address underperformance by focusing on its most profitable brands, simplified productivity and performance-oriented leadership. The new plan was announced after the group reported a mainly price-driven 3Q sales growth--while volumes fell--and backed its 2023 guidance. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (michael.susin@wsj.com)

news.body:
By Michael Susin
Unilever's new chief executive, Hein Schumacher, set out a plan for the coming years aimed at remedying some of the group's underperformance as it reported a fall in third-quarter sales but backed its full-year guidance.

news.headline: Leapmotor Shares Fall After Stellantis Takes Stake in EV Maker for $1.58 Billion
news.body:
By Jiahui Huang
Zhejiang Leapmotor Technology's shares were lower at the mid-day break after initially rising on news of a 1.5 billion euro ($1.58 billion) investment by Stellantis in the Chinese electric-vehicle maker.

news.headline: Stellantis Invests EUR1.5 Billion in Chinese EV Company Leapmotor
news.body:
By Ben Glickman
Stellantis has invested EUR1.5 billion ($1.58 billion) in Chinese electric-vehicle business Leapmotor as the automaker seeks to expand global sales through a joint venture.

news.headline: Airbus to Charter New Low-Emission Vessels for Transatlantic Parts Shipments -- OPIS
news.body: Airbus will charter a fleet of three new low-emission ships to transport aircraft subassemblies between production facilities in Europe and in the U.S., the company said Wednesday.

news.headline: Stellantis Close to Buying 20% of Chinese EV Company Leapmotor, Bloomberg Reports
news.body: -- Stellantis is nearing a deal to buy around 20% of Zhejiang Leapmotor Technology, a Chinese electric-vehicle maker, Bloomberg reported citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: Shell Cuts 200 Jobs From Low-Carbon Solutions Unit
news.body:
By Christian Moess Laursen
Shell plans to cut around 200 jobs at its low-carbon solutions division in 2024 as part of its efforts to simplify the business structure, the energy giant said Wednesday.

news.headline: Orange, MasMovil Plan to Sell Spain Assets to Digi Over EU Concerns, Reuters Reports
news.body: --Orange and MasMovil plan to sell assets to address European Union authorities' competition concerns over their proposed combination in Spain and picked Romania's Digi Communications as the buyer, Reuters reports, citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: European Fintech Shares Plunge on Economic Slowdown Concerns
news.body: Shares of companies operating in the European fintech industry slumped on Wednesday after France's Worldline warned of a slowdown in the German market, long regarded as the economic powerhouse of the continent.

news.headline: Heineken Backs 2023 Views Despite Seeing Weakening Consumer Demand -- Update
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Heineken backed its full-year guidance after third-quarter revenue slightly missed market expectations, as the group focus on improving business performance amid a slowing consumer demand.

news.headline: Heineken Backs 2023 Guidance After 3Q Revenue Rose But Missed Expectations
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Heineken backed its full-year guidance after reporting a third-quarter revenue increase that was slightly below market expectations.

news.headline: Stellantis Renews Commercial Van Lineup
news.body: Stellantis shared a new lineup of commercial vans for its Citroen, Fiat Professional, Opel, Peugeot and Vauxhall brands as it seeks to double commercial-vehicle revenue by the end of the decade.

news.headline: Airbus Teams Up With Northrop Grumman in Bid for UK Military Satellite Program
news.body: Airbus is partnering with Northrop Grumman in its bid for a U.K. program aimed at developing a new constellation of military communications satellites for the country's armed forces.

news.headline: Airbus Signs EUR1.2 Billion in Contracts for French A330 MRTT Fleet
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Airbus said that it has signed capability-enhancement and in-service support contracts for the French A330 Multi Role Tanker Transport fleet worth 1.2 billion euros ($1.27 billion).

title: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI
description: The S&P Global's Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) measures the state of the manufacturing sector and provides key insights into the Russian Federation's overall economic condition. When the PMI is above 50, it indicates positive business conditions and is typically favorable for the Ruble. Conversely, a PMI below 50 suggests negative conditions and is viewed as unfavorable for the Ruble.

news.headline: Nordic Stocks Dropped Friday; Truecaller Series B Took Biggest Hit
news.body:
Nordic stocks declined Friday, with the OMX Nordic 40 Index declining 0.9%.
Truecaller AB Series B posted the largest decline during the session, cratering 31.9%, followed by Electrolux Professional AB Series B shares, which plunged 17.8%. Shares of Electrolux AB Series B tumbled 13.6%.

news.body:
By Robb M. Stewart
Agnico Eagle Mines expects production for the year to come in toward the upper end of its target after a court in Finland restored the gold producer's operating permit for its Kittila mine in the country's north, allowing it to operate at a higher capacity.

news.headline: Russia's Central Bank Raises Key Rate More Than Expected
news.body:
By Paul Hannon
Russia's central bank raised its key interest rate for the fourth time in an effort to contain a surge in inflation as manpower and other resources are diverted to sustain the invasion of Ukraine.

news.headline: UniCredit Shareholders Approve EUR2.5 Billion Buyback Plan
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
UniCredit shareholders have given their approval for the Italian bank to buyback up to 2.5 billion euros worth ($2.64 billion) of shares.

news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Airbus said it was awarded a U.K. Ministry of Defence contract to provide support for a military satellite communications system.

news.headline: Universal Music Shares Plunge After Streaming Growth Disappoints
news.body: Shares of Universal Music Group slumped in Friday morning trading after revenue growth from streaming came below analysts' expectations for the third quarter.

news.headline: Sanofi Shares Tumble After Warning of Profit Hit From Investment, Taxes
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of Sanofi fell sharply after the company warned it expects business earnings for next year to be hit by its plans to boost investment in research and development and changes in global tax regulations.

news.headline: Sanofi Backs Guidance After Earnings, Sales Miss Views
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi confirmed its 2023 guidance after it reported business earnings and sales that came in slightly below consensus forecasts, with currency headwinds offsetting a strong launch of its Beyfortus vaccine.

news.headline: Eni Raises Guidance After 3Q Beat Expectations Despite Weaker Prices
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Eni raised its full-year operating profit guidance after third-quarter results beat analysts' expectations, boosted by the exploration and production division.

news.headline: Siemens Acquisition of Heliox Faces UK Competition Probe
news.body:
By Michael Susin
The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority said it has launched an investigation regarding the acquisition of Heliox by a Siemens subsidiary.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Split Consumer-Healthcare, Pharma Businesses -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi plans to split its consumer-healtchare and pharmaceutical operations, making it the latest big drugmaker to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.headline: CaixaBank's 3Q Profit Boosted by Higher Lending Income
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
CaixaBank reported a rise in third-quarter profit on higher lending income despite a decline in its loans portfolio.

news.body:

Sanofi said it plans to spin off its consumer-healthcare unit into a publicly listed entity, making it the latest pharmaceutical giant to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.body: Safran confirmed its forecasts for the year after revenue jumped in the third quarter as air traffic for narrowbody jets translated into strong demand for spare parts.

title: Purchasing Managers Index Manufacturing (MoM)
description: The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) is a gauge of business conditions in the manufacturing sector, provided by Silf and FöreningsSparbanken. Since the manufacturing sector contributes significantly to the overall GDP, the manufacturing PMI is a crucial indicator of business conditions and the overall economic situation in Sweden. If the PMI reading is above 50, it indicates a positive outlook for the Krona, while a reading below 50 suggests a negative outlook.

Compagnie de Saint-Gobain said it aims to achieve a new record operating margin this year, despite reporting a decline in third-quarter sales.

title: SVME - Purchasing Managers' Index
description: The SVME Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) is a report generated by the Schweizerischer Verband für Materialwirtschaft und Einkauf and Credit Suisse. It provides information about the current state of affairs in the manufacturing industry in Switzerland. The Manufacturing PMI is a significant tool for assessing production growth in the country. A reading above 50 indicates a positive outlook for the CHF, while a reading below 50 is viewed as unfavorable.

news.headline: Novartis Says FDA Deems Pluvicto Shortage Resolved, Supply Set to Increase Into 2024
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Novartis said that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has classified the Pluvicto drug shortage status as resolved, and that supply availability should continue to increase into 2024.

news.headline: Roche Gets FDA Approval for Vabysmo as Retinal Vein Occlusion Treatment
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding said it received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for Vabysmo as treatment of macular edema following retinal vein occlusion, the drug's third indication.

news.headline: STMicroelectronics Shares Fall After Guidance Disappoints
news.body: STMicroelectronics shares fell Thursday after the European chip maker set guidance below analysts' expectations for the fourth quarter and slightly tweaked its forecasts for the year.

news.headline: STMicroelectronics Posts Higher Revenue Amid Strong Automotive Market Demand
news.body: STMicroelectronics reported higher revenue for the third quarter led by growth at its automotive division that offset weak sales at its personal electronics business.

news.headline: Novartis Raises Earnings Guidance Again After Key Drugs Boost Profit, Sales -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Novartis raised its full-year earnings guidance for the third time this year after it reported higher net profit and sales for the third quarter, boosted by strong sales of key drugs.

news.headline: Novartis Raises Earnings Guidance After Key Drugs Boost Profit, Sales
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Novartis raised its full-year earnings guidance for the third time this year after it reported higher net profit and sales for the third quarter, boosted by strong sales of key drugs.

news.headline: Trending: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant and Pfizer
news.body: 1504 ET -- Roche Holding and Pfizer are among the most mentioned companies in the U.S. across all news items in the last 12 hours, according to Factiva data. Roche agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer, a deal that includes $7.1 billion upfront and a near-term milestone payment of $150 million. Telavant is developing a bowel-disease treatment. On Friday, Pfizer said the Food and Drug Administration approved Penbraya, a vaccine for meningococcal disease. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (josh.beckerman@wsj.com)

news.headline: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant, Pfizer in Deal Worth Up to $7.25 Billion -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding has agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in a deal worth up to $7.25 billion as the Swiss pharmaceutical giant seeks to bolster its immunology pipeline.

news.headline: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in $7.25 Billion Deal
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding has agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in a deal worth up to $7.25 billion that will give it rights to a therapy for inflammatory bowel disease and potentially multiple other indications.

news.headline: BioMarin Pharmaceutical's Achondroplasia Treatment Gets FDA Approval for All Pediatric Patients
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
BioMarin Pharmaceutical said the Food and Drug Administration has approved its new drug application to treat all pediatric patients with a growth condition.

news.headline: UBS Names Roger Von Mentlen Chair of UBS, Credit Suisse Swiss Banks' Boards
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
UBS Group said Roger von Mentlen will be appointed as chairman of UBS and Credit Suisse's Swiss banks under a restructuring of their boards of directors as part of the integration of the two businesses.

news.headline: Roche Shares Fall on Lower Sales Due to Currency Hit
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares in Roche Holding fell after the company reported lower sales for the first nine months and flagged a bigger hit from currency movements than previously expected.

news.headline: Nestle's Nine-Month Organic Sales Growth Missed Expectations--Update
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Nestle posted a lower-than-expected organic sales growth in the first nine months of the year and confirmed its outlook.

news.headline: Nestle Organic Sales Grow, Driven by Price Increases; Backs Outlook
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Nestle reported a 7.8% organic sales growth in the first nine months of the year driven by price increases amid high inflation levels, and backed its full-year outlook.

news.headline: SAP Backs Guidance After 3Q Revenue Boost
news.body: SAP confirmed its guidance for the year after posting higher revenue and operating profit for the third quarter, led by growth at its core cloud business.

news.headline: Roche Backs Guidance After Sales Fall
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding confirmed its 2023 guidance after a fall in sales for the first nine months, with growth in its pharmaceutical division overshadowed by a sharp drop in diagnostics sales due to weaker Covid-19-related demand.

news.headline: Credit Suisse to be Inspected by Singapore's Central Bank, Bloomberg Reports
news.body: -- The Monetary Authority of Singapore, the city-state's central bank, will inspect the local offices of Credit Suisse, one of several banks it will examine to see if wealthy clients were properly monitored, Bloomberg reports, citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: ABB Shares Slip After Results Fall Short of Expectations
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of ABB fell after the European technology and engineering giant reported third-quarter results that fell short of consensus expectations at the top and bottom lines, and flagged weakness in its robotics segment.

news.headline: ABB's Rise in 3Q Earnings Falls Short of Expectations -- Update
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
ABB reported a jump in third-quarter profit and revenue, helped by pricing and backlog conversion, but missed analyst expectations.

news.headline: Roche Lung Cancer Drug Reduced Risk of Recurrence, Death in Late-Stage Trial
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding's Alecensa drug reduced the risk of disease recurrence or death in a phase 3 trial for a type of non-small cell lung cancer at an early stage, the company said Wednesday.

title: Retail Sales
description: Retail Sales data, published by the Census and Statistics Department, reflects the overall amount of goods and services purchased by consumers from retail stores. This data is significant as it offers insights into consumer spending, which is a key component of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP). An increase in retail sales suggests a robust economic growth. However, if the surge in sales exceeds the predicted amount, it could lead to inflationary pressures.

news.body:

Industrial & Commercial Bank of China posted flat net profit in the third quarter, as lower credit costs helped offset weaker earnings from the bank's lending and other regular operations.

news.body:

China Petroleum & Chemical Corp.'s third-quarter net profit rose 34%, supported by stronger oil product sales.

news.body:

China Construction Bank's third-quarter profit climbed thanks to lower credit costs, despite a drop in interest income owing to lower market interest rates.

news.body:

Standard Chartered PLC's third-quarter underlying net profit dropped 30%, weighed by higher credit impairment and operating expenses.

Li Ning's shares fell sharply after the Chinese sportswear maker's third-quarter retail sales missed market expectations.

news.body:

Hong Kong will cut taxes on home purchases and stock trades, part of efforts to revive its credentials as a financial hub and boost a struggling property market.

Great Wall Motor has become the first company to formally respond to a European antisubsidy investigation into China's electric-vehicle makers, and is pressing forward with plans to open a factory in the region as it seeks to expand overseas.

news.body:

Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing's third-quarter net profit saw steady growth, supported by higher net investment income.

Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing's third-quarter profit rose 30%, supported by higher net investment income.

news.body:
By Jiahui Huang
Shares of BYD rose after the Chinese electric-vehicle maker said quarterly profit could double on record sales, a forecast that comes as the company looks to overtake industry pioneer Tesla in sales volume.

By Ben Otto
Chinese automaker BYD Co. expects third-quarter profit to rise at least 67% on the back of record electric-vehicle sales.

news.headline: Former Head of Bank of China and Cexim Bank Arrested on Corruption Charges
news.body:
By Costas Paris
Veteran banker Liu Liange the former head of the Bank of China and the Export-Import Bank of China has been arrested on corruption charges, according to the Supreme People's Procuratorate.

news.headline: Baidu Says Its AI Model Now Rivals OpenAI's
news.body:
By Sherry Qin
China's Baidu unveiled a new generative artificial intelligence model that it said rivals OpenAI's ChatGPT, as part of its efforts to lead the race for AI development in the world's second-largest economy.

news.body:

Tencent-backed J&T Global Express is the latest logistics-related company seeking to tap investors' appetite in Hong Kong with a 3.92 billion Hong Kong dollar ($500.80 million) share offering.

news.headline: Vinci Lifts 2023 Free Cash Flow Guidance After 3Q Revenue Rose
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Vinci backed its 2023 guidance and lifted its free cash flow outlook for the year after third-quarter revenue rose.

news.headline: TotalEnergies 3Q Profit Boosted by Higher Oil Prices, Refining Margins -- Update
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
TotalEnergies' profit rose in the third quarter of the year boosted by higher oil prices and refining margins, while shareholder distribution is in line with the company's recently upgraded strategy.

news.headline: Correction to TotalEnergies Article
news.body: The company will distribute a third interim dividend of 74 European cents a share for 2023. "TotalEnergies Posts Higher 3Q Profit, Increases Dividend," at 0636 GMT, incorrectly said the third interim dividend amounted to 0.74 European cents a share.

news.headline: STMicroelectronics Shares Fall After Guidance Disappoints
news.body: STMicroelectronics shares fell Thursday after the European chip maker set guidance below analysts' expectations for the fourth quarter and slightly tweaked its forecasts for the year.

news.headline: BNP Paribas Shares Slip After Profit Fall, French Retail Bank Weakness
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of BNP Paribas fell after the lender reported a lower net profit for the third quarter and said earnings at its French retail-banking operations slipped.

news.headline: Schneider Electric Shares Fall After Flat 3Q Sales
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Schneider Electric sales fell on Thursday after the French energy-management and automation group posted third-quarter revenue that was largely flat on year, missing expectations.

news.headline: Danone Lifts Sales Growth Guidance on Improving Volume, Mix
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Danone raised its full-year sales growth guidance after recording a sequential improvement in volume/mix in sales in the third quarter.

news.headline: Leapmotor Shares Fall After Stellantis Takes Stake in EV Maker for $1.58 Billion
news.body:
By Jiahui Huang
Zhejiang Leapmotor Technology's shares were lower at the mid-day break after initially rising on news of a 1.5 billion euro ($1.58 billion) investment by Stellantis in the Chinese electric-vehicle maker.

news.headline: Schneider Electric Backs 2023 Targets After Flat Third-Quarter Revenue
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Schneider Electric has backed its full-year outlook after reporting flattish third-quarter revenue that was just shy of analysts' expectations.

title: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI
description: The S&P Global Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) measures the state of the manufacturing sector in Greece. It is a significant gauge of business conditions and the broader economic situation in the country. When the PMI is above 50, it is considered positive for the Euro, while a result below 50 is considered negative.

news.headline: Nordic Stocks Dropped Friday; Truecaller Series B Took Biggest Hit
news.body:
Nordic stocks declined Friday, with the OMX Nordic 40 Index declining 0.9%.
Truecaller AB Series B posted the largest decline during the session, cratering 31.9%, followed by Electrolux Professional AB Series B shares, which plunged 17.8%. Shares of Electrolux AB Series B tumbled 13.6%.

Agnico Eagle Mines expects production for the year to come in toward the upper end of its target after a court in Finland restored the gold producer's operating permit for its Kittila mine in the country's north, allowing it to operate at a higher capacity.

news.body:

UniCredit shareholders have given their approval for the Italian bank to buyback up to 2.5 billion euros worth ($2.64 billion) of shares.

news.headline: Universal Music Shares Plunge After Streaming Growth Disappoints
news.body: Shares of Universal Music Group slumped in Friday morning trading after revenue growth from streaming came below analysts' expectations for the third quarter.

news.headline: Sanofi Shares Tumble After Warning of Profit Hit From Investment, Taxes
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of Sanofi fell sharply after the company warned it expects business earnings for next year to be hit by its plans to boost investment in research and development and changes in global tax regulations.

news.headline: Sanofi Backs Guidance After Earnings, Sales Miss Views
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi confirmed its 2023 guidance after it reported business earnings and sales that came in slightly below consensus forecasts, with currency headwinds offsetting a strong launch of its Beyfortus vaccine.

news.headline: Eni Raises Guidance After 3Q Beat Expectations Despite Weaker Prices
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Eni raised its full-year operating profit guidance after third-quarter results beat analysts' expectations, boosted by the exploration and production division.

news.body:
By Michael Susin
The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority said it has launched an investigation regarding the acquisition of Heliox by a Siemens subsidiary.

news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi plans to split its consumer-healtchare and pharmaceutical operations, making it the latest big drugmaker to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.headline: CaixaBank's 3Q Profit Boosted by Higher Lending Income
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
CaixaBank reported a rise in third-quarter profit on higher lending income despite a decline in its loans portfolio.

news.headline: Sanofi Plans to Spin Off Consumer-Healthcare Business
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Sanofi said it plans to spin off its consumer-healthcare unit into a publicly listed entity, making it the latest pharmaceutical giant to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

news.body:

title: S&P Global/CIPS Manufacturing PMI
description: The PMI manufacturing data, released by both the Chartered Institute of Purchasing & Supply and S&P Global, reflects the economic conditions in the manufacturing industry in the UK. It is important to note that the performance of the service sector in the country does not have an impact on these results. Traders prefer to see a higher reading as it is seen as positive for the GBP. A reading above 50 indicates expansion, whereas a reading below 50 indicates contraction.

news.headline: The FTSE 100 Closed Down 0.9% on Earnings Disappointment, Geopolitical Tensions
news.body: The FTSE 100 closed down 0.9% Friday as mainly disappointing earnings and heightened tensions in the Middle East led to another weekly loss for global stock indices, IG analyst Axel Rudolph says in a note. "Heightened tensions in the Middle East and a plethora of central bank decisions by the likes of the BoJ, Fed and BoE will dominate the calendar next week ahead of Friday's all-important U.S. Non-Farm Payrolls," Rudolph says. NatWest--down 12%--was the session's biggest faller after reporting that 3Q pretax profit and net income missed consensus, followed by Lloyds Banking, down 3.4%, and Weir Group, down 3.1%. Rentokil Initial was the day's biggest riser, up 3.6%.

news.headline: FTSE 100 Closed Down 0.8% dragged by Standard Chartered
news.body: The FTSE 100 closed down 0.8% Thursday weighed by Standard Chartered--which reported a 33% drop in third quarter pretax profit and was the session's biggest faller, down 12%. Furthermore, the latest GDP numbers from the U.S. pointed to it being some time before the Federal Reserve cuts rates. Ocado was the day's biggest riser, up 5.9%, followed by Croda International, up 1.8% and IAG, up 1.8% ahead of Friday's third-quarter earnings.

news.body: Unilever's new CEO Hein Schumacher on Thursday outlined a plan to tackle part of the business underperformance and simplify it in order to achieve the board's middle-term targets through production optimization and focusing investments.

news.headline: Trending: Unilever Sets Out Action Plan to Address Underperformance
news.body: 1011 GMT - Unilever is the second-most mentioned company across news items over the past two hours, according to Factiva data. The Anglo-Dutch retailer--which owns consumer brands such as Ben & Jerry's ice cream and Dove soap--set out on Thursday an action plan to address underperformance by focusing on its most profitable brands, simplified productivity and performance-oriented leadership. The new plan was announced after the group reported a mainly price-driven 3Q sales growth--while volumes fell--and backed its 2023 guidance. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (michael.susin@wsj.com)

news.body:

title: MBA Mortgage Applications
description: The Mortgage Bankers Association publishes the MBA Mortgage Applications report, which provides information on different types of mortgage applications. This report is considered a reliable indicator of the U.S. housing market and is used to assess its overall health. When there is an increase in mortgage applications, it indicates a strong housing market that can positively impact the entire U.S. economy. Typically, a high reading on this report is seen as favorable for the value of the U.S. dollar, while a low reading is viewed as unfavorable.

title: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI
description: The S&P Global's Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) is a measure of business conditions specifically in the manufacturing sector. Given that the manufacturing sector plays a significant role in the overall GDP, the manufacturing PMI serves as a crucial indicator of business conditions and the state of the economy in the United States. If the PMI reading is above 50, it suggests that the economy is growing, which is generally seen as positive for the USD and perceived as a bullish signal by investors. On the other hand, if the PMI reading falls below 50, it indicates an economic contraction, which has a negative impact on the currency.

title: Construction Spending (MoM)
description: The Construction Spending, which is released by the US Census Bureau, is a gauge used to measure the total spending on construction in the United States across various categories. The residential construction part of the measurement is particularly helpful in forecasting future national new home sales and mortgage origination volume. A high value is seen as favorable or optimistic for the US dollar, whereas a low value is viewed as unfavorable or pessimistic.

news.headline: Soybean Futures Higher Ahead of Potentially Tumultuous Weekend -- Daily Grain Highlights
news.body:
By Kirk Maltais
-- Soybeans for January delivery rose 1.3% to $13.17 1/2 a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade on Friday, with commodities across the board rising ahead of the likelihood of escalating military operations in the Israel-Gaza conflict this weekend.

news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Coherus BioSciences and Shanghai Junshi Biosciences said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved its Loqtorzi antibody to treat nasopharyngeal cancer when used with chemotherapy.

news.headline: Trending: Some Analysts Raise Intel Price Target
news.body: 14:37 -- Intel is one of the most mentioned companies in the U.S. across all news items in the last 12 hours, according to Factiva data. Some analysts, including HSBC and Morgan Stanley, raised their price targets on Intel stock Friday, after the company reported third-quarter financial results that came in better than estimates. The stock is enjoying one of its best days in a year on Friday. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (stephen.nakrosis@wsj.com)

news.headline: Charter Shares Fall 9% After Soft 3Q Broadband Gains, Higher CapEx
news.body:
By Will Feuer
Shares of Charter Communications fell after the cable giant reported a deceleration in new broadband subscribers and said it will spend more on upgrading its network this year than planned.

news.headline: Correction to Data Week Ahead
news.body: "Nonfarm Payrolls Seen Up 180K -- Data Week Ahead" published at 156 p.m. ET misstated the forecast as +180K instead of +175K in the headline.

title: EIA Crude Oil Stocks Change
description: The EIA Crude Oil stockpiles report, published by the Energy Information Administration, provides a weekly update on the amount of crude oil and its byproducts held in storage. This report often causes significant fluctuations in oil prices, which in turn can have an impact on global economies, particularly on currencies tied to commodities like the Canadian dollar. While the report may not have a major effect on currencies, it does tend to influence the price of oil itself, especially impacting WTI crude futures.

news.headline: Preview -- Barron's
news.body:
Wednesday 11/1
The Bureau of Labor Statistics releases the Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey for September. There were 9.61 million job openings on the last business day of August, down from a peak of just over 12 million in March of 2022, but still well above historical averages.

news.headline: Coherus BioSciences Shares Climb 12% on FDA Approval for Cancer Treatment Loqtorzi
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Shares of Coherus BioSciences climbed 12% to $2.96 in after-hours trading after the company said the Food and Drug Administration approved Loqtorzi to treat nasopharyngeal cancer when used with chemotherapy.

news.headline: Wells Fargo Vice Chairman Thomas Nides to Leave Co., Turn Attention to Middle East
news.body:
By Stephen Nakrosis
Wells Fargo said Vice Chairman Thomas Nides, the former U.S. Ambassador to Israel, will leave the company, effective immediately, to return his attention to events unfolding in the Middle East.

news.headline: Intuitive Machines Sets January Date for NASA Lunar Mission
news.body:
By Stephen Nakrosis
Intuitive Machines said its IM-1 lunar mission, an attempted lunar landing as part of a National Aeronautics and Space Administration initiative, will take place in January of next year.

news.headline: Morgan Stanley Awards Next CEO, Other Candidates Awards Valued at $20 Million
news.body:
By Denny Jacob
Morgan Stanley issued stock-based awards to its next chief executive officer and other leaders who were in the running for the top job.

news.headline: Tupperware Brands Loses PcW as Auditor
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
Tupperware Brands said PricewaterhouseCoopers isn't willing to stand for reappointment as its accounting firm, according to a Securities and Exchange Commission filing.

title: Total Vehicle Sales
description: The Autodata Corp. provides data on Total Vehicle sales, which is a measure of vehicle sales in the United States. This data is often used as an indicator of consumer confidence. When the Total Vehicle sales reading is high, it is viewed as positive or bullish for the USD. Conversely, when the reading is low, it is seen as negative or bearish.

title: Labour Cost Index (QoQ)
description: The labour cost index (LCI) is a measure provided by Statistics New Zealand that tracks changes in salary and wage rates for a consistent amount and quality of labor input. The index does not account for changes in salary due to promotions based on merit, performance-based increases or decreases, or other types of service-related increments.

news.body:
