title: Building Permits (MoM)
description: The data from Statistics Canada on Building Permits reveals the quantity of permits issued for new construction endeavors, which indicates the level of corporate investments in the Canadian economy. These permits can affect the value of the CAD, potentially leading to fluctuations. A higher number of permits typically has a positive or optimistic impact on the CAD.

title: Continuing Jobless Claims
description: The Counting Jobless Claims report, published by the US Department of Labor, tracks the number of people who are without a job and are currently receiving unemployment benefits. This report indicates the state of the labor market. An increase in this measure is associated with a decrease in consumer spending, which can slow down economic growth. In general, a high reading of this report is considered negative or bearish for the USD, while a low reading is seen as positive or bullish.

title: Initial Jobless Claims 4-week average
description: This measure calculates the average of the past four reports of Initial Jobless Claims, which are released every Thursday. It is published by the US Department of Labor and indicates the number of individuals filing new claims for state unemployment benefits. It serves as an indicator of the labor market's health and an increased value suggests weakness in the market, impacting the strength and trajectory of the US economy. In general, a decline in this indicator is considered positive or bullish for the USD.

title: Central Bank Reserves $
description: The Central Bank of the Russian Federation has published the Central Bank Reserves, which indicates the amount of foreign currency and gold reserves held by the bank. These reserves serve as a safeguard for countries that are vulnerable to financial crises and can also be used to influence exchange rates. A high reading of these reserves is considered favorable for the Russian Ruble, while a low reading is seen as unfavorable.

news.headline: Nordic Stocks Dropped Friday; Truecaller Series B Took Biggest Hit
news.body:
Nordic stocks declined Friday, with the OMX Nordic 40 Index declining 0.9%.
Truecaller AB Series B posted the largest decline during the session, cratering 31.9%, followed by Electrolux Professional AB Series B shares, which plunged 17.8%. Shares of Electrolux AB Series B tumbled 13.6%.

news.headline: Agnico Eagle Expects 2023 Production at High End of Guidance After Finland Mine's Permit Restored
news.body:
By Robb M. Stewart
Agnico Eagle Mines expects production for the year to come in toward the upper end of its target after a court in Finland restored the gold producer's operating permit for its Kittila mine in the country's north, allowing it to operate at a higher capacity.

news.headline: Russia's Central Bank Raises Key Rate More Than Expected
news.body:
By Paul Hannon
Russia's central bank raised its key interest rate for the fourth time in an effort to contain a surge in inflation as manpower and other resources are diverted to sustain the invasion of Ukraine.

news.headline: UniCredit Shareholders Approve EUR2.5 Billion Buyback Plan
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
UniCredit shareholders have given their approval for the Italian bank to buyback up to 2.5 billion euros worth ($2.64 billion) of shares.

news.headline: Airbus Gets Support Contract for UK Military Satellite System
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Airbus said it was awarded a U.K. Ministry of Defence contract to provide support for a military satellite communications system.

news.headline: Universal Music Shares Plunge After Streaming Growth Disappoints
news.body: Shares of Universal Music Group slumped in Friday morning trading after revenue growth from streaming came below analysts' expectations for the third quarter.

news.headline: Sanofi Shares Tumble After Warning of Profit Hit From Investment, Taxes
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of Sanofi fell sharply after the company warned it expects business earnings for next year to be hit by its plans to boost investment in research and development and changes in global tax regulations.

news.body:

title: 4-Week Bill Auction
description: The calendar shows the average return on Treasury bills sold by the US Department of Treasury. These bills are short-term investments that mature in one year or less. The return, or yield, on these bills is the amount of money an investor will earn by holding the bond until it matures. Investors keep an eye on the volatility of the yield and compare the average rate at each auction to the rate at previous auctions of the same security. This helps them gauge the government's debt situation.

title: Consumer Price Index (MoM)
description: The Swiss Federal Statistical Office releases the Consumer Price Index (CPI), which calculates how the prices of goods and services commonly bought by households change over time. The CPI is an important tool for measuring inflation and shifts in consumer buying habits. Inflation can decrease the purchasing power of the Swiss Franc (CHF). A higher CPI value is beneficial for the CHF, while a lower value is detrimental.

news.headline: Trending: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant and Pfizer
news.body: 1504 ET -- Roche Holding and Pfizer are among the most mentioned companies in the U.S. across all news items in the last 12 hours, according to Factiva data. Roche agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer, a deal that includes $7.1 billion upfront and a near-term milestone payment of $150 million. Telavant is developing a bowel-disease treatment. On Friday, Pfizer said the Food and Drug Administration approved Penbraya, a vaccine for meningococcal disease. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. title: HCOB Manufacturing PMI
description: The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI), which is published by S&P Global and Hamburg Commercial Bank (HCOB), measures business conditions in the manufacturing sector. Since the manufacturing sector has a significant impact on the overall GDP, the manufacturing PMI is a crucial indicator for assessing business conditions and the overall economic situation in Italy. If the result is above 50, it is considered positive for the Euro, while a result below 50 is seen as negative.

title: Unemployment Rate s.a.
description: The Unemployment Rate, published by the German Statistics Office and based on data from the Bundesagentur für Arbeit, measures the percentage of unemployed individuals in Germany, taking into account seasonal adjustments. A decrease in this rate has a favorable impact on consumer spending, which in turn encourages economic growth. Typically, a decrease in this indicator is seen as positive for the EUR currency, whereas an increase is viewed as negative.

title: Unemployment Change
description: The Unemployment Change, which is released by the Bundesagentur für Arbeit and published by the German Statistics Office, is a measure that shows the total change in the number of unemployed individuals in Germany using data that has been adjusted for seasonal factors. An increase in this measurement has negative consequences for consumer spending because fewer people are employed, which leads to a decrease in economic growth within the country. Typically, if the reading is higher than expected, it is viewed as negative (or bearish) for the EUR currency, while a lower reading is seen as positive (or bullish).

news.headline: Hugo Boss Raises $185 Million for Investment Plan
news.body:

news.headline: German Business Sentiment Ticked Up in October on Renewed Optimism -- Update
news.body:
By Ed Frankl
Business sentiment in Germany improved in October, snapping five consecutive months of declines, as firms in the manufacturing, services and construction sectors became more optimistic on future expectations.

news.headline: German Business Sentiment Ticked Up in October
news.body:
By Ed Frankl
Business sentiment in Germany improved in October, snapping five consecutive months of declines, as firms in the manufacturing, services and construction sectors became more encouraged by future expectations.

news.body:

news.headline: Uniper Refines Full-Year Outlook as Hedging Boosts Nine-Month Results
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Uniper refined its full-year outlook on the back of a strong performance in the first nine months as it continued to benefit from hedging transactions tied to its power-generation and gas midstream businesses.

news.headline: Porsche AG Revenue, Operating Profit Rise; Return on Sales Slips
news.body:

Porsche AG on Wednesday confirmed its 2023 guidance after reporting a jump in revenue and operating profit but a lower return on sales through the first nine months of the year.

news.headline: Beiersdorf Upgrades Sales Guidance After Strong Nine-Month Results

news.headline: New York to Make Largest-Ever State Investment in Renewable Energy
news.body:

title: Unit Labor Costs
description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics, Department of Labor releases the Unit Labor Cost, which represents the overall expense of employing a workforce. This data can provide insights into changes in production costs, stock prices, and inflation. When the reading is high, it is considered favorable or bullish for the USD. Conversely, a low reading is viewed as negative or bearish.

title: Initial Jobless Claims
description: The Initial Jobless Claims report from the US Department of Labor is a measure of the number of individuals who are filing for unemployment insurance for the first time. Essentially, it shows how well the job market is doing. If the number is higher than anticipated, it suggests that there is weakness in the job market, which can have an impact on the strength and trajectory of the US economy. In general, a decreasing number is seen as a positive sign for the US dollar.

title: Nonfarm Productivity
description: The Non-farm Productivity report by the Bureau of Labor Statistics in the US Department of Labor reveals the amount of output produced for each hour of labor. This measurement reflects the overall state of businesses in the US and has an impact on the country's GDP. A higher reading is considered favorable (or positive) for the USD currency, while a lower reading is seen as unfavorable (or negative).

title: Trade Balance (MoM)
description: The trade balance, as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, refers to the discrepancy between the value of imports and exports of Australian goods. The export data can be a useful indicator of Australian economic growth, while imports can provide insight into domestic demand. The trade balance gives an early indication of the overall export performance. If there is consistent demand for Australian exports, this can result in a positive growth in the trade balance, which would be beneficial for the Australian dollar (AUD).

Some analysts, including HSBC and Morgan Stanley, raised their price targets on Intel stock Friday, after the company reported third-quarter financial results that came in better than estimates. The stock is enjoying one of its best days in a year on Friday. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (stephen.nakrosis@wsj.com)

news.headline: Charter Shares Fall 9% After Soft 3Q Broadband Gains, Higher CapEx
news.body:
By Will Feuer
Shares of Charter Communications fell after the cable giant reported a deceleration in new broadband subscribers and said it will spend more on upgrading its network this year than planned.

news.headline: Verano Shares Down After Suing DOJ Over Marijuana Prohibition
news.body:
By Dean Seal
Shares of Verano Holdings declined after the company and others sued Attorney General Merrick Garland to strike down federal marijuana restrictions.

news.headline: Toronto Stocks Slide; Corus Entertainment Plummets on Dividend Suspension
news.body:
By Adriano Marchese
Stocks in Toronto were firmly in red territory midday Friday. Statistics Canada reported that advance results of wholesale sales for the month of September in Canada point to flat.

news.headline: Duke Energy to Help Build Clean Energy System to Produce Green Hydrogen
news.body:
By Chris Wack
Duke Energy will break ground in the near future in DeBary, Fla., on a demonstration project to successfully create clean energy using an end-to-end system to produce, store and combust 100% green hydrogen.

title: Consumer Price Index (YoY)
description: The Swiss Federal Statistical Office releases the Consumer Price Index (CPI) which tracks the average price fluctuations of goods and services bought by households for consumption. CPI is a critical tool for monitoring inflation and shifts in purchasing habits. Inflation reduces the purchasing power of the Swiss Franc (CHF), so a higher CPI reading is beneficial for the CHF, whereas a lower reading is unfavorable.

news.headline: Novartis Says FDA Deems Pluvicto Shortage Resolved, Supply Set to Increase Into 2024
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Novartis said that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has classified the Pluvicto drug shortage status as resolved, and that supply availability should continue to increase into 2024.

news.headline: Roche Gets FDA Approval for Vabysmo as Retinal Vein Occlusion Treatment
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding said it received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for Vabysmo as treatment of macular edema following retinal vein occlusion, the drug's third indication.

news.headline: STMicroelectronics Shares Fall After Guidance Disappoints
news.body: STMicroelectronics shares fell Thursday after the European chip maker set guidance below analysts' expectations for the fourth quarter and slightly tweaked its forecasts for the year.

news.headline: STMicroelectronics Posts Higher Revenue Amid Strong Automotive Market Demand
news.body: STMicroelectronics reported higher revenue for the third quarter led by growth at its automotive division that offset weak sales at its personal electronics business.

news.headline: Novartis Raises Earnings Guidance Again After Key Drugs Boost Profit, Sales -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Novartis raised its full-year earnings guidance for the third time this year after it reported higher net profit and sales for the third quarter, boosted by strong sales of key drugs.

news.headline: Novartis Raises Earnings Guidance After Key Drugs Boost Profit, Sales
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Novartis raised its full-year earnings guidance for the third time this year after it reported higher net profit and sales for the third quarter, boosted by strong sales of key drugs.

news.headline: Trending: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant and Pfizer
news.body: 1504 ET -- Roche Holding and Pfizer are among the most mentioned companies in the U.S. across all news items in the last 12 hours, according to Factiva data. Roche agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer, a deal that includes $7.1 billion upfront and a near-term milestone payment of $150 million. Telavant is developing a bowel-disease treatment. On Friday, Pfizer said the Food and Drug Administration approved Penbraya, a vaccine for meningococcal disease. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (josh.beckerman@wsj.com)

news.headline: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant, Pfizer in Deal Worth Up to $7.25 Billion -- Update
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding has agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in a deal worth up to $7.25 billion as the Swiss pharmaceutical giant seeks to bolster its immunology pipeline.

news.headline: Roche to Buy Telavant From Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in $7.25 Billion Deal
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding has agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in a deal worth up to $7.25 billion that will give it rights to a therapy for inflammatory bowel disease and potentially multiple other indications.

news.headline: BioMarin Pharmaceutical's Achondroplasia Treatment Gets FDA Approval for All Pediatric Patients
news.body:
By Sabela Ojea
BioMarin Pharmaceutical said the Food and Drug Administration has approved its new drug application to treat all pediatric patients with a growth condition.

news.headline: UBS Names Roger Von Mentlen Chair of UBS, Credit Suisse Swiss Banks' Boards
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
UBS Group said Roger von Mentlen will be appointed as chairman of UBS and Credit Suisse's Swiss banks under a restructuring of their boards of directors as part of the integration of the two businesses.

news.headline: Roche Shares Fall on Lower Sales Due to Currency Hit
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares in Roche Holding fell after the company reported lower sales for the first nine months and flagged a bigger hit from currency movements than previously expected.

news.headline: Nestle's Nine-Month Organic Sales Growth Missed Expectations--Update
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Nestle posted a lower-than-expected organic sales growth in the first nine months of the year and confirmed its outlook.

news.headline: Nestle Organic Sales Grow, Driven by Price Increases; Backs Outlook
news.body:
By Giulia Petroni
Nestle reported a 7.8% organic sales growth in the first nine months of the year driven by price increases amid high inflation levels, and backed its full-year outlook.

news.headline: SAP Backs Guidance After 3Q Revenue Boost
news.body: SAP confirmed its guidance for the year after posting higher revenue and operating profit for the third quarter, led by growth at its core cloud business.

news.headline: Roche Backs Guidance After Sales Fall
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding confirmed its 2023 guidance after a fall in sales for the first nine months, with growth in its pharmaceutical division overshadowed by a sharp drop in diagnostics sales due to weaker Covid-19-related demand.

news.headline: Credit Suisse to be Inspected by Singapore's Central Bank, Bloomberg Reports
news.body: -- The Monetary Authority of Singapore, the city-state's central bank, will inspect the local offices of Credit Suisse, one of several banks it will examine to see if wealthy clients were properly monitored, Bloomberg reports, citing unnamed sources.

news.headline: ABB Shares Slip After Results Fall Short of Expectations
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Shares of ABB fell after the European technology and engineering giant reported third-quarter results that fell short of consensus expectations at the top and bottom lines, and flagged weakness in its robotics segment.

news.headline: ABB's Rise in 3Q Earnings Falls Short of Expectations -- Update
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
ABB reported a jump in third-quarter profit and revenue, helped by pricing and backlog conversion, but missed analyst expectations.

news.headline: Roche Lung Cancer Drug Reduced Risk of Recurrence, Death in Late-Stage Trial
news.body:
By Adria Calatayud
Roche Holding's Alecensa drug reduced the risk of disease recurrence or death in a phase 3 trial for a type of non-small cell lung cancer at an early stage, the company said Wednesday.

title: Monetary Policy Report
description: The Bank of England's Monetary Policy Report provides information on their decision regarding interest rates and policies, and also includes an analysis of the economic conditions that influenced those decisions. The report is particularly significant as it presents a discussion on the future economic prospects and provides indications on how future votes may be influenced.

news.headline: Marsh & McLennan to Delist From London Stock Exchange
news.body:
By Ben Glickman
Marsh & McLennan will delist its shares from the London Stock Exchange, the company said.

news.headline: FTSE 100 Index Ends the Week 1.50% Lower at 7291.28 -- Data Talk
news.body:
The FTSE 100 Index is down 110.86 points or 1.50% this week to 7291.28
--Down for two consecutive weeks

news.headline: The FTSE 100 Closed Down 0.9% on Earnings Disappointment, Geopolitical Tensions
news.body: The FTSE 100 closed down 0.9% Friday as mainly disappointing earnings and heightened tensions in the Middle East led to another weekly loss for global stock indices, IG analyst Axel Rudolph says in a note. "Heightened tensions in the Middle East and a plethora of central bank decisions by the likes of the BoJ, Fed and BoE will dominate the calendar next week ahead of Friday's all-important U.S. Non-Farm Payrolls," Rudolph says. NatWest--down 12%--was the session's biggest faller after reporting that 3Q pretax profit and net income missed consensus, followed by Lloyds Banking, down 3.4%, and Weir Group, down 3.1%. Rentokil Initial was the day's biggest riser, up 3.6%.

news.headline: NatWest Down Nearly 12%, on Pace for Largest Percent Decrease Since March 2020 -- Data Talk
news.body:
NatWest Group Plc Sponsored ADR (NWG) is currently at $4.48, down $0.60 or 11.81%
--Would be lowest close since Feb. 1, 2021, when it closed at $4.42

news.headline: NatWest Shares Drop After Guidance Cut; Farage Account Closure Review Flags 'Serious Failings' -- 2nd Update
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
NatWest Group shares tumbled after the bank cut its full-year net interest margin guidance and admitted "serious failings" in its treatment of Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage after an investigation into the handling of his account.

news.headline: Airbus Gets Support Contract for UK Military Satellite System
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Airbus said it was awarded a U.K. Ministry of Defence contract to provide support for a military satellite communications system.

news.headline: NatWest Shares Drop After Guidance Cut, 3Q Miss; Says Review Found Farage Account Closure Lawful -- Update
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
NatWest Group shares tumbled 16% at market open after the bank said an investigation into the handling of the accounts of Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage found that their closure was lawful; and cut its full-year net interest margin guidance, following peer Barclays earlier this week.

news.headline: NatWest Cuts Guidance After 3Q Miss; Says Review Found Farage Account Closure Lawful
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
NatWest Group said an investigation into the handling of the accounts of Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage found that it was lawful; and cut its full-year net interest margin guidance, following peer Barclays earlier this week.

news.headline: Siemens Acquisition of Heliox Faces UK Competition Probe
news.body:
By Michael Susin
The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority said it has launched an investigation regarding the acquisition of Heliox by a Siemens subsidiary.

news.body:
MARKET WRAPS

news.headline: FTSE 100 Closed Down 0.8% dragged by Standard Chartered
news.body: The FTSE 100 closed down 0.8% Thursday weighed by Standard Chartered--which reported a 33% drop in third quarter pretax profit and was the session's biggest faller, down 12%. Furthermore, the latest GDP numbers from the U.S. pointed to it being some time before the Federal Reserve cuts rates. Rentokil Initial and B&M European Value Retail were down 11% and 5% respectively. Ocado was the day's biggest riser, up 5.9%, followed by Croda International, up 1.8% and IAG, up 1.8% ahead of Friday's third-quarter earnings.

news.headline: FTSE 100 Index Ends 0.81% Lower at 7354.57 -- Data Talk
news.body:
The FTSE 100 Index is down 59.77 points or 0.81% today to 7354.57
--Largest one day point and percentage decline since Friday, Oct. 20, 2023

news.headline: Tesco PLC UK CEO Jason Tarry to Leave March; Matthew Barnes Named Successor
news.body:
By Ian Walker
Tesco PLC said that its U.K. Chief Executive Jason Tarry is leaving the company next March after more than 33 years with the group.

news.headline: BP to Acquire EV Charging Units From Tesla for $100 Million
news.body:
By Dean Seal
BP has signed a $100 million deal to acquire ultra-fast charging hardware units from Tesla.

news.headline: Unilever CEO Sets Out New Plan to Simplify Business, Rebuild Margins -- At a Glance
news.body: Unilever's new CEO Hein Schumacher on Thursday outlined a plan to tackle part of the business underperformance and simplify it in order to achieve the board's middle-term targets through production optimization and focusing investments.

news.headline: Trending: Unilever Sets Out Action Plan to Address Underperformance
news.body: 1011 GMT - Unilever is the second-most mentioned company across news items over the past two hours, according to Factiva data. The Anglo-Dutch retailer--which owns consumer brands such as Ben & Jerry's ice cream and Dove soap--set out on Thursday an action plan to address underperformance by focusing on its most profitable brands, simplified productivity and performance-oriented leadership. The new plan was announced after the group reported a mainly price-driven 3Q sales growth--while volumes fell--and backed its 2023 guidance. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (michael.susin@wsj.com)

news.headline: Kerry Group Sees 2023 Views at Lower End on Tough Backdrop; To Buyback $317 Million in Shares
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Kerry Group said its 2023 earnings are expected to be at the bottom of its guidance range as its Dairy Ireland business is being hit by challenging market conditions, and announced a share buyback.

news.headline: Kromek Shares Rise After $5.9 Million Biosecurity Contract With US Government
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
Kromek Group shares rose after the company said it got a $5.9 million contract from the U.S. government's Department of Homeland Security to help it detect and identify biological threats.

news.headline: Unilever CEO Outlines Shake-up Plans to Boost Performance After 3Q Sales Beat Views -- 2nd Update
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Unilever's new chief executive, Hein Schumacher, outlined plans aimed at remedying some of the group's underperformance while the company backed its full-year guidance after third-quarter sales slipped by less than feared.

news.headline: Unilever's New CEO Sets Out Plan to Improve Performance After 3Q Sales Drop -- Update
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Unilever's new chief executive, Hein Schumacher, set out a plan for the coming years aimed at remedying some of the group's underperformance as it reported a fall in third-quarter sales but backed its full-year guidance.

title: BoE Minutes
description: The Bank of England (BoE) releases the minutes of its monetary policy committee (MPC) meetings, which include a comprehensive overview of the policy discussion and any contrasting opinions. These minutes also document the voting decisions of each committee member. In general, if the BoE expresses concern about rising inflation in the economy (a hawkish stance), it is viewed positively by the markets, as it increases the likelihood of a rate hike, which in turn strengthens the GBP.

news.body:

title: Bank of England Monetary Policy Report
description: The Bank of England releases a report every three months that includes a thorough analysis of the economy and predictions for inflation. This report guides the Bank's Monetary Policy Committee when making decisions about interest rates. It also provides an evaluation of how inflation in the UK is likely to develop in the next two years. If the report indicates a high reading, it is generally viewed as favorable for the GBP, while a low reading is considered negative.

By Michael Susin
Kerry Group said its 2023 earnings are expected to be at the bottom of its guidance range as its Dairy Ireland business is being hit by challenging market conditions, and announced a share buyback.

news.headline: Kromek Shares Rise After $5.9 Million Biosecurity Contract With US Government
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
Kromek Group shares rose after the company said it got a $5.9 million contract from the U.S. government's Department of Homeland Security to help it detect and identify biological threats.

news.headline: Unilever CEO Outlines Shake-up Plans to Boost Performance After 3Q Sales Beat Views -- 2nd Update
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Unilever's new chief executive, Hein Schumacher, outlined plans aimed at remedying some of the group's underperformance while the company backed its full-year guidance after third-quarter sales slipped by less than feared.

news.headline: Unilever's New CEO Sets Out Plan to Improve Performance After 3Q Sales Drop -- Update
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Unilever's new chief executive, Hein Schumacher, set out a plan for the coming years aimed at remedying some of the group's underperformance as it reported a fall in third-quarter sales but backed its full-year guidance.

title: BoE MPC Vote Rate Hike
description: The Bank's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) consists of nine members, including the Governor, two Deputy Governors, the Bank's Chief Economist, the Executive Director for Markets, and four external members. This committee is responsible for setting interest rates based on the belief that it will help meet the inflation target. The inclusion of external members in the MPC aims to bring in diverse perspectives and expertise beyond what is already present within the Bank of England.

news.headline: Marsh & McLennan to Delist From London Stock Exchange
news.body:
By Ben Glickman
Marsh & McLennan will delist its shares from the London Stock Exchange, the company said.

news.headline: FTSE 100 Index Ends the Week 1.50% Lower at 7291.28 -- Data Talk
news.body:
The FTSE 100 Index is down 110.86 points or 1.50% this week to 7291.28
--Down for two consecutive weeks

news.headline: The FTSE 100 Closed Down 0.9% on Earnings Disappointment, Geopolitical Tensions
news.body: The FTSE 100 closed down 0.9% Friday as mainly disappointing earnings and heightened tensions in the Middle East led to another weekly loss for global stock indices, IG analyst Axel Rudolph says in a note. "Heightened tensions in the Middle East and a plethora of central bank decisions by the likes of the BoJ, Fed and BoE will dominate the calendar next week ahead of Friday's all-important U.S. Non-Farm Payrolls," Rudolph says. NatWest--down 12%--was the session's biggest faller after reporting that 3Q pretax profit and net income missed consensus, followed by Lloyds Banking, down 3.4%, and Weir Group, down 3.1%. Rentokil Initial was the day's biggest riser, up 3.6%.

news.headline: NatWest Down Nearly 12%, on Pace for Largest Percent Decrease Since March 2020 -- Data Talk
news.body:
NatWest Group Plc Sponsored ADR (NWG) is currently at $4.48, down $0.60 or 11.81%
--Would be lowest close since Feb. 1, 2021, when it closed at $4.42

news.headline: NatWest Shares Drop After Guidance Cut; Farage Account Closure Review Flags 'Serious Failings' -- 2nd Update
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
NatWest Group shares tumbled after the bank cut its full-year net interest margin guidance and admitted "serious failings" in its treatment of Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage after an investigation into the handling of his account.

news.headline: Airbus Gets Support Contract for UK Military Satellite System
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Airbus said it was awarded a U.K. Ministry of Defence contract to provide support for a military satellite communications system.

news.headline: NatWest Shares Drop After Guidance Cut, 3Q Miss; Says Review Found Farage Account Closure Lawful -- Update
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
NatWest Group shares tumbled 16% at market open after the bank said an investigation into the handling of the accounts of Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage found that their closure was lawful; and cut its full-year net interest margin guidance, following peer Barclays earlier this week.

news.headline: NatWest Cuts Guidance After 3Q Miss; Says Review Found Farage Account Closure Lawful
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
NatWest Group said an investigation into the handling of the accounts of Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage found that it was lawful; and cut its full-year net interest margin guidance, following peer Barclays earlier this week.

news.headline: Siemens Acquisition of Heliox Faces UK Competition Probe
news.body:
By Michael Susin
The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority said it has launched an investigation regarding the acquisition of Heliox by a Siemens subsidiary.

news.body:
MARKET WRAPS
Watch For:

news.headline: FTSE 100 Closed Down 0.8% dragged by Standard Chartered
news.body: The FTSE 100 closed down 0.8% Thursday weighed by Standard Chartered--which reported a 33% drop in third quarter pretax profit and was the session's biggest faller, down 12%. Furthermore, the latest GDP numbers from the U.S. pointed to it being some time before the Federal Reserve cuts rates. Rentokil Initial and B&M European Value Retail were down 11% and 5% respectively. Ocado was the day's biggest riser, up 5.9%, followed by Croda International, up 1.8% and IAG, up 1.8% ahead of Friday's third-quarter earnings.

news.headline: FTSE 100 Index Ends 0.81% Lower at 7354.57 -- Data Talk
news.body:
The FTSE 100 Index is down 59.77 points or 0.81% today to 7354.57
--Largest one day point and percentage decline since Friday, Oct. 20, 2023

news.headline: Tesco PLC UK CEO Jason Tarry to Leave March; Matthew Barnes Named Successor
news.body:
By Ian Walker
Tesco PLC said that its U.K. Chief Executive Jason Tarry is leaving the company next March after more than 33 years with the group.

news.headline: BP to Acquire EV Charging Units From Tesla for $100 Million
news.body:
By Dean Seal
BP has signed a $100 million deal to acquire ultra-fast charging hardware units from Tesla.

news.headline: Unilever CEO Sets Out New Plan to Simplify Business, Rebuild Margins -- At a Glance
news.body: Unilever's new CEO Hein Schumacher on Thursday outlined a plan to tackle part of the business underperformance and simplify it in order to achieve the board's middle-term targets through production optimization and focusing investments.

news.headline: Trending: Unilever Sets Out Action Plan to Address Underperformance
news.body: 1011 GMT - Unilever is the second-most mentioned company across news items over the past two hours, according to Factiva data. The Anglo-Dutch retailer--which owns consumer brands such as Ben & Jerry's ice cream and Dove soap--set out on Thursday an action plan to address underperformance by focusing on its most profitable brands, simplified productivity and performance-oriented leadership. The new plan was announced after the group reported a mainly price-driven 3Q sales growth--while volumes fell--and backed its 2023 guidance. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (michael.susin@wsj.com)

title: BoE Interest Rate Decision
description: The Bank of England's announcement of the BoE Interest Rate Decision determines the direction of interest rates. If the BoE expresses concerns about inflation and decides to increase interest rates, it is considered positive or optimistic for the GBP. On the other hand, if the BoE has a pessimistic view of the UK economy and maintains the current interest rate or reduces it, it is seen as negative or pessimistic.

title: BoE MPC Vote Rate Cut
description: The Bank's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) determines interest rates in order to achieve the inflation target. This committee consists of nine members, including the Governor, Deputy Governors, Chief Economist, Executive Director for Markets, and four external members appointed by the Chancellor. title: BoE Asset Purchase Facility
description: The Asset Purchase Facility is a monetary policy measure implemented by the Bank of England. It involves the creation of money and its injection into the economy through the purchase of open market bonds. This tool, also known as Quantitative Easing, is used to influence long-term interest rates.

news.headline: Marsh & McLennan to Delist From London Stock Exchange
news.body:
By Ben Glickman
Marsh & McLennan will delist its shares from the London Stock Exchange, the company said.

news.headline: FTSE 100 Index Ends the Week 1.50% Lower at 7291.28 -- Data Talk
news.body:
The FTSE 100 Index is down 110.86 points or 1.50% this week to 7291.28
--Down for two consecutive weeks

news.headline: The FTSE 100 Closed Down 0.9% on Earnings Disappointment, Geopolitical Tensions
news.body: The FTSE 100 closed down 0.9% Friday as mainly disappointing earnings and heightened tensions in the Middle East led to another weekly loss for global stock indices, IG analyst Axel Rudolph says in a note. "Heightened tensions in the Middle East and a plethora of central bank decisions by the likes of the BoJ, Fed and BoE will dominate the calendar next week ahead of Friday's all-important U.S. Non-Farm Payrolls," Rudolph says. NatWest--down 12%--was the session's biggest faller after reporting that 3Q pretax profit and net income missed consensus, followed by Lloyds Banking, down 3.4%, and Weir Group, down 3.1%. Rentokil Initial was the day's biggest riser, up 3.6%.

news.headline: NatWest Down Nearly 12%, on Pace for Largest Percent Decrease Since March 2020 -- Data Talk
news.body:
NatWest Group Plc Sponsored ADR (NWG) is currently at $4.48, down $0.60 or 11.81%
--Would be lowest close since Feb. 1, 2021, when it closed at $4.42

news.headline: NatWest Shares Drop After Guidance Cut; Farage Account Closure Review Flags 'Serious Failings' -- 2nd Update
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
NatWest Group shares tumbled after the bank cut its full-year net interest margin guidance and admitted "serious failings" in its treatment of Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage after an investigation into the handling of his account.

news.headline: Airbus Gets Support Contract for UK Military Satellite System
news.body:
By Pierre Bertrand
Airbus said it was awarded a U.K. Ministry of Defence contract to provide support for a military satellite communications system.

news.headline: NatWest Shares Drop After Guidance Cut, 3Q Miss; Says Review Found Farage Account Closure Lawful -- Update
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
NatWest Group shares tumbled 16% at market open after the bank said an investigation into the handling of the accounts of Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage found that their closure was lawful; and cut its full-year net interest margin guidance, following peer Barclays earlier this week.

news.headline: NatWest Cuts Guidance After 3Q Miss; Says Review Found Farage Account Closure Lawful
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
NatWest Group said an investigation into the handling of the accounts of Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage found that it was lawful; and cut its full-year net interest margin guidance, following peer Barclays earlier this week.

news.headline: Siemens Acquisition of Heliox Faces UK Competition Probe
news.body:
By Michael Susin
The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority said it has launched an investigation regarding the acquisition of Heliox by a Siemens subsidiary.

news.body:
MARKET WRAPS

news.headline: FTSE 100 Closed Down 0.8% dragged by Standard Chartered
news.body: The FTSE 100 closed down 0.8% Thursday weighed by Standard Chartered--which reported a 33% drop in third quarter pretax profit and was the session's biggest faller, down 12%. Furthermore, the latest GDP numbers from the U.S. pointed to it being some time before the Federal Reserve cuts rates. Rentokil Initial and B&M European Value Retail were down 11% and 5% respectively. Ocado was the day's biggest riser, up 5.9%, followed by Croda International, up 1.8% and IAG, up 1.8% ahead of Friday's third-quarter earnings.

news.headline: FTSE 100 Index Ends 0.81% Lower at 7354.57 -- Data Talk
news.body:
The FTSE 100 Index is down 59.77 points or 0.81% today to 7354.57
--Largest one day point and percentage decline since Friday, Oct. 20, 2023

news.headline: Tesco PLC UK CEO Jason Tarry to Leave March; Matthew Barnes Named Successor
news.body:
By Ian Walker
Tesco PLC said that its U.K. Chief Executive Jason Tarry is leaving the company next March after more than 33 years with the group.

news.headline: BP to Acquire EV Charging Units From Tesla for $100 Million
news.body:
By Dean Seal
BP has signed a $100 million deal to acquire ultra-fast charging hardware units from Tesla.

news.headline: Unilever CEO Sets Out New Plan to Simplify Business, Rebuild Margins -- At a Glance
news.body: Unilever's new CEO Hein Schumacher on Thursday outlined a plan to tackle part of the business underperformance and simplify it in order to achieve the board's middle-term targets through production optimization and focusing investments.

news.headline: Trending: Unilever Sets Out Action Plan to Address Underperformance
news.body: 1011 GMT - Unilever is the second-most mentioned company across news items over the past two hours, according to Factiva data. The Anglo-Dutch retailer--which owns consumer brands such as Ben & Jerry's ice cream and Dove soap--set out on Thursday an action plan to address underperformance by focusing on its most profitable brands, simplified productivity and performance-oriented leadership. The new plan was announced after the group reported a mainly price-driven 3Q sales growth--while volumes fell--and backed its 2023 guidance. Dow Jones & Co. owns Factiva. (michael.susin@wsj.com)

news.headline: Kerry Group Sees 2023 Views at Lower End on Tough Backdrop; To Buyback $317 Million in Shares
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Kerry Group said its 2023 earnings are expected to be at the bottom of its guidance range as its Dairy Ireland business is being hit by challenging market conditions, and announced a share buyback.

news.headline: Kromek Shares Rise After $5.9 Million Biosecurity Contract With US Government
news.body:
By Elena Vardon
Kromek Group shares rose after the company said it got a $5.9 million contract from the U.S. government's Department of Homeland Security to help it detect and identify biological threats.

news.headline: Unilever CEO Outlines Shake-up Plans to Boost Performance After 3Q Sales Beat Views -- 2nd Update
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Unilever's new chief executive, Hein Schumacher, outlined plans aimed at remedying some of the group's underperformance while the company backed its full-year guidance after third-quarter sales slipped by less than feared.

news.headline: Unilever's New CEO Sets Out Plan to Improve Performance After 3Q Sales Drop -- Update
news.body:
By Michael Susin
Unilever's new chief executive, Hein Schumacher, set out a plan for the coming years aimed at remedying some of the group's underperformance as it reported a fall in third-quarter sales but backed its full-year guidance.

title: BoE's Governor Bailey speech
description: Andrew Bailey became the Governor of the Bank of England on March 16th, 2020, succeeding Mark Carney. Prior to this role, Bailey was the Chief Executive of the Financial Conduct Authority. He also held positions as the Deputy Governor of the Bank of England from April 2013 to July 2016 and as the Chief Cashier of the Bank of England from January 2004 to April 2011.
